Text: What the...? It's all pictures of the Steel Samurai.

Name: Cody
Text: I go to every live performance!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Those stupid publicity stunts where they beat each other up in public...?)

Name: Cody
Text: I always take a picture when the Steel Samurai lands the final blow! Whizzam! I got 'em all! I never missed one! A perfect collection! Check it out! My new digital camera!

Name: Mia
Text: Wow, that's very impressive. The newest model, isn't it?

Name: Cody
Text: You bet, lady! I just got it for my birthday. My album has a name, wanna hear it? "The Steel Samurai: Path To Glory." The Steel Samurai always wins! Always! Hey, if you want this, you can have it, lady.

Name: Mia
Text: Really? Are you sure?

Name: Cody
Text: Yeah, I took these with a digital camera. I got all the data at home so I can always make another one.

Name: Mia
Text: Well, then I'm happy to accept! Thank you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What's with people always giving stuff to Mia? What a life!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: You were here on the day of the... incident, right?

Name: Cody
Text: Yeah...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did you see anything unusual?

Name: Mia
Text: Cody.

Name: Mia
Text: Cody, he needs to know because he's fighting for justice. Isn't that the Steel Samurai's motto? "For great justice"? You have to help us fight for great justice, too.

Name: Cody
Text: I... I saw... I saw everything!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Well, well... We might get some useful information out of him yet.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Cody... I need to ask you something very important. What did you see on the day of the incident?

Name: Cody
Text: ... I got here that day around 2:00... I had to come in through the woods out back so that old lady wouldn't see me. I got kinda lost, though. I was in there for maybe a half hour or so. Then I finally got to the studio. After that...

Name: Mia
Text: What is it, Cody?

Name: Cody
Text: Th-the Steel Samurai killed the bad guy! He used his Samurai Spear! Just like always! One shot, one kill! It happened so fast... I got scared. I went home after that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... I see. It must have been hard for you.

Name: Cody
Text: Man, you say those nice things but it's so obvious you aren't speaking from the heart.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Umm... right.) Mia?

Name: Mia
Text: Yes?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I think we can say for sure this means the Steel Samurai did it.

Name: Mia
Text: True enough.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And the director has an alibi, so it wasn't him.

Name: Mia
Text: Indeed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So... the only person left who it could have been is Will Powers!

Name: Mia
Text: ... I have to admit, it's kind of a shock. But if you put this boy on the witness stand, your client will be "guilty" for sure.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Let's not call him then...

Name: Mia
Text: I think that would be wise. Best to leave this one alone.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Not so fast, pal!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: I heard everything! This boy here's a key witness! And he's under police protection, starting now! C'mon, son. You've got a rendezvous with me down at the precinct!

Name: Cody
Text: No! I ain't going! Waah!

Name: Mia
Text: ... That didn't go so well. We're back to zero leads. And now we have a serious handicap in court.

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-what're we going to do, Mia!

Name: Mia
Text: Well, hmm... I... really need to be going. Don't worry, Phoenix. I'm sure you'll be fine!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whoa whoa whoa! C-come to the trial tomorrow, please! I need you there!

Name: Mia
Text: Phoenix, can I ask you something? Do you really believe that Mr. Powers is innocent?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Of course he is!

Name: Mia
Text: ... That's all I wanted to hear. Excellent. I'll see you in court, then.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Great! Thanks, Mia!

Name: Mia
Text: See you soon.

Name: Will
Text: ... ... Umm... Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes?

Name: Will
Text: Why do you look so... unhappy?

Name: Phoenix
Text: O-oh! Oh, nothing! Eh heh heh. Really, it's nothing. Right, Mia? (Uh oh. She looks even unhappier...)

Name: Mia
Text: Phoenix. Your client is now practically a dead man walking... Perhaps that's why I feel particularly close to him.

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is no time for dead-people jokes, please.

Name: Mia
Text: You know we're going into this trial utterly defenseless. Yet, if Mr. Powers is truly innocent... We should be able to find something overlooked in the evidence to prove it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Something "overlooked"...?

Name: Mia
Text: We have to find something, Phoenix, today. It's that, or lose the trial.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This isn't going to be easy.)

Name: Judge
Text: The court is now in session for the trial of Mr. Will Powers.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. Mr. Edgeworth, your opening statement, please.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: An unexpected fact has come to the attention of the court. Yesterday, we learned that there were other people present at the studios! Today, I would like to show evidence proving they had nothing to do with the murder.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. You may call your first witness, Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I wonder if that producer is going to come out...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution calls Mr. Sal Manella to the stand.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (... or that director.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Will the witness state his name and profession?

Name: Manella
Text: ... How r00d can j00 get! J00 don't know ME!? I'm the director! I make the Steel Samurai, n00b! ROFL!

Name: Manella
Text: S... Sal Manella. I'm a director. Television.

Name: Judge
Text: Were you at Global Studios on the day of the murder?

Name: Manella
Text: Y-yes, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Very well. Please testify to the court about the events of that day.

Name: Mia
Text: Phoenix. Let's start by picking this testimony apart. If Powers is innocent, you know what that means. Someone in the trailer on that day did it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: R-right. (She doesn't waste any time putting on the pressure!)

Name: Manella
Text: I was at the studios from around 9:00 that morning.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Is that when you always come in to work?

Name: Manella
Text: Oh, oh no. I come in all sort of hours. It's the "industry" way.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Yeah, I know all about the freaks in your "industry"...)

Name: Manella
Text: Still, FWIW, I was pretty busy all that day. :(

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Tell us more about that.

Name: Manella
Text: During the morning, I was doing... umm... an action scene run-through.

Name: Phoenix
Text: In the Employee Area?

Name: Manella
Text: That's right. It was a fight scene between the Steel Samurai and the Evil Magistrate.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Was anyone else at the run-through?

Name: Manella
Text: Oh, yeah. That security lady was sitting there watching the whole thing. LOL. She was cheering on Hammer, if you can believe it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (She certainly has the lungs for it...) Anyone else?

Name: Manella
Text: Nope, just us four.

Name: Manella
Text: It took a lot more time than I thought it would.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why did it go on so long?

Name: Manella
Text: Um, I'm pretty sure j00've already heard about this... But WP twisted his ankle during the run-through, see...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh, right, thus the limp.)

Name: Manella
Text: Which of course led to me missing my lunch. ROFS!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (ROFS? Rolling on the Floor... Starving?)

Name: Manella
Text: I hear that everyone else ate lunch in the Employee Area...

Name: Phoenix
Text: What exactly did they have for lunch?

Name: Manella
Text: T-bone steak! The assistant cooked some up.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Come to think of it, there was a plate with some bones on it in the Employee Area.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: "Everyone else" meaning that the witness did not eat with them.

Name: Manella
Text: But I had a meeting in the Studio Two trailer, so I ended up skipping lunch.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, in the end, you didn't get to eat?

Name: Manella
Text: Yeah. No steak, at least! Can j00 believe it?

Name: Phoenix
Text: That must have been tough.

Name: Mia
Text: Phoenix.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah?

Name: Mia
Text: Doesn't something about that seem odd to you?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah, it does seem odd, now that you mention it. Mr. Manella!

Name: Manella
Text: H-hmm? W-what do j00 mean? *sweats*

Name: Phoenix
Text: When I went to that trailer, I saw something on the table. There were two plates on the table--the same kind of plates as in the Employee Area. Who ate lunch there?

Name: Manella
Text: M-mmpf! No, er, ah, um, eh heh. Good call! *sweats* I, er, I was embarrassed so I didn't mention it... But I did eat, after all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A t-bone steak, you mean?

Name: Manella
Text: Yeah, well, I mean the assistant went through all that trouble... I brought it to the trailer thinking I could eat it later.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Clearly a man who likes to eat. I'd suspected as much...) So, when exactly did you eat it?

Name: Manella
Text: We took one break during that meeting. I, er, wolfed it down then. *drool*

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A mental image I will carry with me to my grave... Wait a second...! If they took a break in that meeting, that contradicts his testimony! I'll press on that one a bit more...)

Name: Manella
Text: We were in the meeting until around 4:00...

Name: Phoenix
Text: What were you discussing?

Name: Manella
Text: The Steel Samurai story, and our budget. Get this! The sponsors turn to me and say, "Mr. Manella. Those scripts of yours are not appropriate for children." Can j00 believe it!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Actually, I kind of can.) So, nobody left the table during the whole meeting?

Name: Manella
Text: During the meeting, well, I'm pretty sure no one left their chairs.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: You didn't take a single break?

Name: Manella
Text: Er... well... Y-yeah! Not a one! *sweats*

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... what's he sweating so much about, I wonder? If only I had an idea... Wait a second... Maybe I do have an idea!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait a second! Mr. Manella, you've just contradicted yourself! Didn't you just tell the court that you ate that t-bone steak during a break?

Name: Manella
Text: Oops! ROFL!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well?

Name: Manella
Text: Umm...

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Manella, what's this all about?

Name: Manella
Text: W-well, yeah, I guess we did take a little break.

Name: Mia
Text: Phoenix! Great job! If they took a break, one of them could have gone to the studio during that time!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! I call on the witness to testify to the court about this break!

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. Mr. Manella, your testimony, please.

Name: Manella
Text: Urk!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Heh heh heh...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh. Edgeworth is laughing...)

Name: Manella
Text: Yeah, FWIW, we took a break... ROFL!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What time exactly did you take this break?

Name: Manella
Text: Hmm... I'd say it was from around 2:30 or so untl 2:45.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (2:30!!! That's the time of death! So he could have gone to Studio One, killed Hammer, and come back... I guess it's possible, time-wise...)

Name: Manella
Text: But it was only 15 minutes! 15! That's only 13 in Base 12!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What were you doing for those 15 minutes?

Name: Manella
Text: Eating my t-bone steak! What else!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: There were two plates on the trailer table...?

Name: Manella
Text: Oh, right. The other one was Diva's... sorry, Dee Vasquez's plate.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Dee Vasquez... the producer.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: To eat a t-bone steak in 15 minutes... that's quite a feat.

Name: Manella
Text: Not enough time for someone to, say, commit murder in Studio One! LOL!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why is that?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Haven't we had enough of this pointless line of questioning? Your Honor! The testimony to this point has made one certain fact painfully clear: The people in the trailer had nothing to do with this murder! It was impossible for any of them to go to Studio One!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Something wrong, Mr. Wright? Surely you aren't suggesting one of the people in the trailer went to Studio One!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Well, Mr. Wright?

Name: Mia
Text: Phoenix, this is critical! Think about it before you give your answer!

Name: Judge
Text: Do you claim someone from the trailer went to Studio One?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I don't want to write off so many possible suspects... But I can't keep claiming the impossible, either...) I agree that it was impossible for anyone in the trailer to go to the studio in that time.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Ha hah! I thought you might be thoughtlessly treading on thin ice again! But I see you had at least an inkling of the truth.

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's quite simple... True, the break in the trailer meeting came right at the time of death... However! The path from there to the scene of the crime was blocked! The fallen Mrs. Monkey head barred the way! At around 2:15, a strong gust of wind knocked off the studio mascot's head. Ergo! When the people in the trailer took a break at 2:30, the way to the studio was blocked. Blocked... by Mrs. Monkey's severed head!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... (It's actually "Mr. Monkey," but Edgeworth has a point... And somehow, I feel no desire to correct him.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I believe we have seen enough evidence. I would like to relieve Mr. Manella from the stand.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Wh-what? It's over?)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. The court's opinion on this case is as follows: We have found that there were several other people in Studio 2 on the day of the murder. However, it is also clear that none of these people could have gone to Studio One. They therefore have no relation to this case. Furthermore, with regards to the photo of the Steel Samurai... Given the size of the costume, no one other than Mr. Powers could have worn it that day. All that is lacking is decisive evidence that he is the one who did it. If we had that, I'm afraid I would have to find Mr. Powers guilty.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor. The prosecution is pleased to announce that we indeed have decisive evidence: a witness.

Name: Judge
Text: Who is this witness, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: My witness saw the very moment when the Steel Samurai skewered the victim!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! I will have order! I see. The court will take a 10 minute recess, after which we will hear your witness. Court is adjourned for recess!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do we do now, Mia? If everyone in that trailer has an alibi...

Name: Mia
Text: ... I'm sorry, Phoenix. I guess I was wrong.

Name: Phoenix
Text: M-Mia! Don't tell me you're giving up! If you give up, what hope do I have...?

Name: Mia
Text: ... Don't get me wrong. I've never given up on a trial before, not while there was a chance. Only one thing became clear in your cross-examination. The people in the trailer could not have gone to Studio One. I thought there was more to it than that... But I was wrong. That's all there is.

Name: Will
Text: Umm... Er... What's going to happen to me? It kinda seems like everyone in that courtroom thinks I did it... They think I'm a murderer!

Name: Mia
Text: Don't worry, Mr. Powers. If you are innocent, we will prove it. I guarantee it. Leave it to us, and... be yourself. Be strong. You are the Steel Samurai, hero to children everywhere, after all.

Name: Will
Text: I... You... Thanks. *sniff*

Name: Mia
Text: Okay, Phoenix. This one's for the kids! Let's do it!

Name: Judge
Text: Court is back in session for the trial of Mr. Will Powers.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution has a concern. As our witness is a grade schooler of tender years, and this is a murder case... We worry that the defense might cause unnecessary trauma with his cruel questioning!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Nice to see Edgeworth taking the moral high ground...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: However, we have no choice. The prosecution calls Cody Hackins to the stand.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor. Perhaps you could arrange a box for him to stand on?

Name: Judge
Text: Oh, r-right. Guard, please bring him a box. One of those donut crates should do.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Will the witness state his name and grade in school.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Witness!

Name: Cody
Text: What!? Just 'cause you're all grown-up don't mean you can push me around!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mrph...

Name: Mia
Text: Cody? Answer his question, okay?

Name: Cody
Text: H-hey, it's you! The nice lady! I'm Cody Hackins. I'm in 2nd grade!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I get the feeling this is going to be a long, long day...)

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Edgeworth. Please remember that you're speaking to a child. Try to be gentle.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: M-mrrrrph! Witness! Er, I mean, Cody.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He's having trouble with this "gentle" thing.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: You were present, er, you were at Global Studios on the day of the, er, incident?

Name: Cody
Text: You got a problem with that!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Please tell us what you saw that day.

Name: Cody
Text: What, pops? You want me to tell you and gramps with the beard over there?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Just.. Mr. Edgeworth will be fine.

Name: Judge
Text: I prefer "bearded gentleman" myself.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (A very long day...)

Name: Judge
Text: Incidentally, photographic equipment is strictly forbidden in this courtroom.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: M-mpht! M-my apologies, Your Honor. He said he wouldn't testify if he couldn't bring it... I'd like special permission, if that's possible.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait, so you're saying you had to bargain terms with a kid... and you LOST?

Name: Cody
Text: Hey! I just got this new camera! Don't really know how to use it all that good yet! But I bring it with me wherever I go!

Name: Mia
Text: Phoenix. I wonder if he had that camera on the day of the murder... You'd better make a note of it in the Court Record.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, Cody. Please testify to the court about what you saw the day of the incident.

Name: Cody
Text: Anyway, I couldn't get into the studio, so I went home.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Very well. The defense may begin its cross-examination. And, be gentle. Remember you're talking to a child.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This kid is tougher than most adults we see in here, honestly...)

Name: Cody
Text: I wanted to see a Steel Samurai rehearsal, just once.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You really like the Steel Samurai, huh?

Name: Cody
Text: Course I do! I've taped every show! And I go to all the live performances!

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's impressive. Have you been to the amusement park?

Name: Cody
Text: Course! Duh! My Dad always takes me!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Poor, poor Dad...)

Name: Cody
Text: I found a map on the Internet, and went to the studios that day.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Was that day the first time you'd been to the studio?

Name: Cody
Text: Uh, actually I've been a couple of times. I never manage to get there on a rehearsal day! And that security lady's always yelling...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Right, right. Please continue.

Name: Cody
Text: Chill, pops! I'm getting to it! How am I supposed to talk with you cuttin' me off all the time? Geez!

Name: Cody
Text: I went through the woods, off the path, so that old lady wouldn't catch me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Off the path"...?

Name: Cody
Text: Yeah, you know how the studios are in a valley there? If you go off the path a little, there's woods. That's where I was!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I see.

Name: Cody
Text: Anyhow...

Name: Cody
Text: I was going for the studio.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did nothing unusual happen on your way to the studio?

Name: Cody
Text: "Unusual"?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did you see this monkey by any chance?

Name: Cody
Text: Oh, you mean Mr. Monkey? Yeah I saw him, but his head wasn't busted!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: So you went straight to the studio?

Name: Cody
Text: I got kinda lost on the way, though. For about 30 minutes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You got lost in the woods?

Name: Cody
Text: Yeah. I couldn't figure out which way I was walking. Man, was I relieved when I saw the blue studio doors. But guess what happened next!

Name: Cody
Text: When I came out by the studio, there was the Steel Samurai!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The Steel Samurai?

Name: Cody
Text: Yeah, he was standing by the studio gate. It looked like he was thinking about something before going in. Then he opened up the gate and went inside.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I see. What then?

Name: Cody
Text: It totally rocked! Right before my eyes, out came the bad guy!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What sort of "bad guy" was it?

Name: Cody
Text: A guy. A person. Kinda tall. Skinny.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you sure it was a guy?

Name: Cody
Text: ... I dunno. He was kinda far away.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Huh, he's being awfully vague...)

Name: Cody
Text: Of course, the Steel Samurai took him down! Pow!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What happened to the bad guy?

Name: Cody
Text: Huh? Well... Well, he kinda didn't move. Not a bit. Like he was dead. I-I guess he's a real pro! What a great actor!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yes, I suppose he was.

Name: Cody
Text: If I had my camera with me, that woulda been the time for a shot, I tell you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: "If" you had your camera? You mean, you weren't carrying your camera then?

Name: Cody
Text: N-no, I wasn't. I-it's not like I have it all the time!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Really...?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Cody, what you just said seems, well, a little strange. Didn't you say before that you always bring your digital camera wherever you go? You were quite clear about that.

Name: Cody
Text: Huh!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Cody, you shouldn't lie here. You understand that, right?

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright! A word with you...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh... was I putting the pressure on too much?)

Name: Judge
Text: What is this "digital" camera contraption you're talking about?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's umm... a digital camera, Your Honor. It's kind of a new sort of camera. (How do I explain that!?)

Name: Judge
Text: I see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Anyway, Cody... I can't believe you wouldn't bring your camera on a trip to the studios! You did bring it, didn't you?

Name: Cody
Text: Umm...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mr. Wright! How cruel you are, to terrorize a poor child so!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I don't care if he's a child or a prosecuting attorney! No one should lie in court!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What do you mean "or a prosecuting attorney"!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, Cody?

Name: Cody
Text: Wh-what! Yeah, so I had my camera. So what!? You got a problem with that!?

Name: Judge
Text: So, you did have a camera? And did you use this camera?

Name: Cody
Text: W-why would I use it? I... I was too busy watching.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Very well. Please testify to the court about what you were so busy watching.

Name: Cody
Text: Y-yeah, I had my camera with me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, why didn't you use it?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: He's getting to that! Relax and listen.

Name: Cody
Text: Umm... I didn't use it 'cause I was too busy watching the real thing!

Name: Cody
Text: But I was glued to the action! I couldn't take my eyes off it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you were watching the Steel Samurai. Did you watch the whole fight?

Name: Cody
Text: Y-yeah, of course!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You didn't turn away, not even once?

Name: Cody
Text: N... no!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Okay, then tell us exactly what happened.

Name: Cody
Text: Y-yeah! I'm getting to that!

Name: Cody
Text: The Steel Samurai, he goes for the bad guy... wham!

Name: Phoenix
Text: So the bad guy attacked him first?

Name: Cody
Text: Yeah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What sort of person was this "bad guy"?

Name: Cody
Text: I told you, a person. He was a person.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How was he dressed?

Name: Cody
Text: ... I kinda don't remember. I was too busy watching the Steel Samurai!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I see. And what happened next?

Name: Cody
Text: Then... then the bad guy stopped moving!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why?

Name: Cody
Text: Huh? Whaddya mean, "why"?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why wasn't the bad guy moving?

Name: Cody
Text: W-well 'cause the Steel Samurai brought him to justice!

Name: Phoenix
Text: And how exactly did he do that?

Name: Cody
Text: H-how did he do it? With a Samurai Kick! And a Samurai Punch! Samurai Chop! ... Samurai Slap! S-something like that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He's still being vague about this...)

Name: Cody
Text: What! Don't give me that look, pops!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (How should I play this?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Cody.

Name: Cody
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Something's bothering me. Before you said that you "couldn't take your eyes off" the action.

Name: Cody
Text: Y-yeah? So what?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yet you missed the most important part!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What is the meaning of this? The witness has stated what he saw quite clearly...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: You know as well as I do that he's being vague! Tell me, what kind of murderer uses a "Samurai Slap"!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: M-mmph!

Name: Phoenix
Text: My point is this: Cody, you may have seen some of the Steel Samurai's fight... But you missed the most important part: the killing blow!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Mr. Wright! How could this be? Can you explain how he might have missed something so vital?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, well... er, that's the thing...

Name: Mia
Text: Phoenix! I believe you're on the right track with this! Think: why didn't Cody see the climax of the fight? I know you! You can figure this out!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright, your answer! We have ascertained that this young boy is a great fan of the Steel Samurai... Why wouldn't he watch the climax of the fight?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor, I have evidence.

Name: Judge
Text: "Evidence"...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Your Honor. Why did Cody look away from the fight?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Here's my proof!

Name: Judge
Text: What's that? The camera...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The witness stated that he recently received this camera.

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, I'm aware of that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: He wasn't entirely familiar with its operation.

Name: Judge
Text: I'm aware of that, too. Ah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Correct! Why would Cody be looking somewhere else at the critical moment? Because he was looking at his camera! He was trying to take a picture!

Name: Cody
Text: Hey!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Bullseye!

Name: Cody
Text: W-what's your problem, pops! You got a thing for picking on little kids!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Pressing, not picking...)

Name: Mia
Text: Good job, Phoenix! Cody was lying, clearly. Smart of you to realize there was no way he could just stand there, watching his hero... and not take a picture!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Right! Cody? There was only one reason why you would have looked away from the fight. And that was because you wanted to take a picture. But having just received your camera, you weren't used to using it yet! So, you missed the climax of the fight. Correct?

Name: Mia
Text: Well, Phoenix. I'll bet you anything he's hiding more than that. Have him testify again!

Name: Phoenix
Text: R-right. (Mia means business!) Your Honor. The defense would like to request that Cody Hackins testify once more.

Name: Judge
Text: V-very well. Cody? Could you please tell us about your camera... And about why you didn't take a picture of the fight?

Name: Cody
Text: Umm...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Welcome to the real world, kid!)

Name: Cody
Text: Yeah, you're right, pops.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Pops"...?

Name: Cody
Text: Yeah, I called you "pops," you spiky-haired geezer!

Name: Phoenix
Text: G-geezer...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'm "Mr. Edgeworth."

Name: Judge
Text: And I guess I'm the "bearded gentleman"...

Name: Cody
Text: That's what I hate about grown-ups. You're all so self-conscious!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Okay, off with the kid gloves! Testify, witness, testify!

Name: Cody
Text: Yipes!

Name: Cody
Text: The Steel Samurai had just escaped from the clutches of the villain.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So you did see the beginning of the fight?

Name: Cody
Text: Yeah.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did you notice anything unusual?

Name: Cody
Text: Umm... well... uh... I guess the Steel Samurai was moving a little strange...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Moving... strangely?)

Name: Cody
Text: So I held up my camera to take a picture!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why couldn't you take a picture?

Name: Cody
Text: My new camera has too many buttons. I couldn't figure it out. I tried to take a picture, I really tried.

Name: Cody
Text: But the lens wouldn't open in time, so I missed it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: When the lens opened, what did you see?

Name: Cody
Text: Uh... well, a person on the ground. And the Steel Samurai!

Name: Cody
Text: Th-that's all that happened. Yup.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's all?

Name: Cody
Text: Y-yeah! I told you, I didn't take a picture!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... I would have, once I got that lens open... Did he really not take a picture? Not even one?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Nah, he definitely would have taken a picture. There's got to be something here I can use!) Cody! Listen up, Cody Hackins. I know exactly what happened that day. You took a picture!

Name: Cody
Text: ... Hey!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Bullseye...?)

Name: Cody
Text: H-how did you know!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I see through all your lies Cody Hackins. It's one of my powers!

Name: Cody
Text: W-wow!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This feels great!)

Name: Cody
Text: Y-yeah... Yeah, I took a picture.

Name: Judge
Text: Perhaps you can change your testimony to reflect this, Cody?

Name: Cody
Text: I took a few shots, but it was too late, so I erased 'em.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: You "erased" them?

Name: Cody
Text: Y-yeah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why would you erase a picture of your beloved Steel Samurai, victorious?

Name: Cody
Text: Well... y'know. W-why would I want to keep a picture like that?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... he's becoming less and less cooperative. I better find a clear contradiction soon... or some solid evidence.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Cody!

Name: Cody
Text: Wh-wh-what!? Man, every time you say "Cody" you follow it with something bad.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I just wanted to thank you for giving me this the other day.

Name: Cody
Text: Huh? O-oh... right.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What was it you told me then?

Name: Cody
Text: I go to every live performance! I always take a picture when the Steel Samurai lands the final blow! Whizzam! I got 'em all! I never missed one! A perfect collection!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Cody. Did you really get a picture of the Steel Samurai standing victorious over his foe? If you did, I find it hard to believe that you would just erase it! Wouldn't you keep it for your album?

Name: Cody
Text: Ah!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright... What exactly is this album?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's called "Path to Glory." It's a collection of pictures of the Steel Samurai, all taken by Cody Hackins. He claims it's a perfect collection of every battle the Steel Samurai has won!

Name: Judge
Text: I... I see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Don't you find this very odd, Your Honor? Among all his pictures of the Steel Samurai, none were taken that day!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Mr. Wright. Have you an explanation? If the Steel Samurai had just defeated his adversary... I certainly would expect to see a picture of it in this album...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Exactly my point, Your Honor! ... ... .........! (No... wait... no way!)

Name: Mia
Text: Phoenix? I think we've finally discovered the truth. And what a truth it is!

Name: Phoenix
Text: M-Mia... are we sure about this? Did he actually...?

Name: Mia
Text: Yes. I'm pretty sure what you're thinking is right. Tell them, Phoenix. Tell them what the truth is.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright! Please explain to the court what is going on here! Why was there no picture in the album from the day of the murder? Why would the boy have erased the photos he took?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I can think of only one reason, your honor. The Steel Samurai didn't win! That's why Cody deleted those photos.

Name: Judge
Text: You mean the Steel Samurai... lost?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, Cody? I'm right, aren't I? Tell the truth. The bad guy defeated the Steel Samurai!

Name: Cody
Text: N-n-n-no way! No! I-it's impossible! Th-the Steel Samurai never loses! He never loses to anyone! Ever!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor... The witness has revealed everything with his words. There was a reason why he lied and told us he didn't take a picture. The same reason he erased his precious photos! For Cody, it was inconceivable that the Steel Samurai could be defeated. However, Cody witnessed the impossible! He saw the Steel Samurai lose! Yet to admit what he saw would destroy everything he believed in! That's why he lied and said the Steel Samurai won. He couldn't handle the truth!

Name: Judge
Text: O-Order! I will have order! W-witness! I mean, Cody! Is this true!? W-what did you see? Tell the court what you saw!

Name: Cody
Text: I...... Uwaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaargh!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Cody... That day, you saw the Steel Samurai lose a fight. Right?

Name: Cody
Text: Waaaaaaaaaaaaah! Okay okay! Y-you're right! Th-the Steel Samurai f-fell down... Th-then he didn't m-move... Waaaaaaaaah!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What kind of stunt are you trying to pull, Wright!? The Steel Samurai was the murderer, not the victim!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yet according to your witness's testimony, the Steel Samurai was the one who fell!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright! What's going on?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Apparently, we have all made a serious error.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: An... error? What's this all about!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: If you understand what really happened, it's actually quite simple. At the end of the fight, the Steel Samurai fell to the ground, and lay still. In other words, the Steel Samurai was not the killer, he was the victim! Don't you see? Jack Hammer was the Steel Samurai!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Order! So, the Steel Samurai in this photograph... You're saying the man in this costume was the victim, Mr. Jack Hammer?

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's what I'm saying, Your Honor. Jack Hammer was present at the action scene run-through that morning. Thus, he obviously knew about Will Powers's foot injury.

Name: Judge
Text: B-but wait! Hadn't Mr. Hammer gone to Studio One already?

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's what everyone thought! But remember what Ms. Oldbag said in her testimony?

Name: Oldbag
Text: On the day of the murder, I arrived at the guard station at 1:00 PM. Did I see poor old Hammer? Nope. He'd already gone to the studio before I got back to the guard station.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Jack Hammer left the Employee Area after lunch. However, no one saw him going to Studio One. Nor was there a picture of him. He waited for Mr. Powers to take a nap in his dressing room. Then he snuck into the dressing room and stole the Steel Samurai costume.

Name: Judge
Text: But why would the victim do such a thing?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... don't know.

Name: Cody
Text: ... I get it!

Name: Cody
Text: I thought that the Steel Samurai was moving strange. So it was a different person inside the suit! Pops!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh, me? What?

Name: Cody
Text: Actually, there was one piece of data I saved.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Data?

Name: Cody
Text: Yeah, a photo on my digital camera!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ! W-what!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Show us, quick!

Name: Cody
Text: No way man, not if you're gonna look at me like that!

Name: Judge
Text: Now!

Name: Cody
Text: *sniff* Here... This is it.

Name: Judge
Text: ... Well, looking at this it's still a little hard to say. I'm afraid that it could be anyone in that costume. Your opinion, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I agree, Your Honor. This isn't decisive evidence.

Name: Judge
Text: I'm sorry, this doesn't look like it's the proof we need. I'll give it back.

Name: Mia
Text: Wait, Phoenix!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mia? What?

Name: Mia
Text: Look at that photo once more! That's it Phoenix! That photo is all the evidence you need to win this trial!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what!? Y-Your Honor! May I see that photo once more please?

Name: Judge
Text: C-certainly. I don't see why not.

Name: Mia
Text: Phoenix! Show him! There's a glaring, decisive inconsistency with the facts as we know them in that photo!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Find the inconsistency in the photo!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! Look at this!

Name: Judge
Text: I see... a gate?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Might I draw your attention to the number on that gate?

Name: Judge
Text: The number? Ah yes. Well, it's hard to see, but it looks like a "2."

Name: Phoenix
Text: Clearly not a "1," Your Honor, correct?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Aaaaaah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I believe Mr. Edgeworth sees what I'm getting at.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: B-but... Th-that's impossible!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm? Eh? What's this all about? Please explain so that I might be shocked along with the rest of the court.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'll use the studio guidemap. The body was found here, in Studio One. However, what do we see in this photo taken at the time of the murder? It does NOT say "1" on that gate in the photo. Your Honor! Here is the true scene of the crime! (Show the judge where the murder took place!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Here, at Studio Two.

Name: Judge
Text: I see! That would explain the "2" on the gate in the photo.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor, I find it very significant that the murder took place in Studio Two!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The path to the trailer was blocked!

Name: Judge
Text: So we have heard.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The path was blocked at 2:15... In other words, the victim went to Studio Two before that time!

Name: Judge
Text: Yes... yes, I suppose that would be the case.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Remember Mr. Sal Manella's testimony? Allow me to remind the court: He said no one in the trailer was guilty because they could not have gone to Studio One. Yet, in actuality, the reverse was true! Only someone in the trailer could have committed this murder! They were the only ones with access to the scene of the crime: Studio Two! As you may recall, there is a trailer in Studio Two. Now, on that day, a meeting was held in that very trailer. There was a break in the meeting corresponding to the time of death. During that break, Mr. Sal Manella and Ms. Dee Vasquez were outside, eating steak. They were at the scene of the crime!

Name: Judge
Text: O-order! Order!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense makes the following claims: The scene of the crime was Studio Two! The person that the security guard, Ms. Oldbag saw was the victim, Mr. Jack Hammer! Mr. Hammer, for some reason, stole a Steel Samurai costume. Then he went to Studio Two!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: This is madness! Jack Hammer is the victim! The victim! Why would he steal a Steel Samurai costume!? Are you suggesting he did so to cover up the details of his own murder!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-well, no, of course not...

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Or do you have proof!? Give me proof that the victim, Jack Hammer, stole the costume!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I have proof!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Y-you do!?

Name: Judge
Text: You do, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Now that they're so surprised suddenly I'm much less confident... I think I'm right, though!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Here's my proof that Jack Hammer stole the costume!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is it.

Name: Judge
Text: An empty... medicine bottle?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I found this on the table in the Employee Area. The same table where Mr. Hammer and Mr. Powers ate. The label reads "sleeping pills."

Name: Judge
Text: "Sleeping pills"...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defendant, Mr. Powers, spent that entire afternoon sleeping. He was drugged... by Mr. Hammer!

Name: Judge
Text: Wait a moment... That bottle does raise some suspicions, yes. But there is no proof that Mr. Hammer used it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor, I have an idea.

Name: Judge
Text: An... idea? Very well, let's hear it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I want to check this bottle for fingerprints! If my claim is true, Mr. Hammer's fingerprints should show up on this bottle!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmm...

Name: Judge
Text: I suppose you're right. Very well. The court will take possession of the bottle.

Name: Judge
Text: This court will suspend proceedings on the current trial for today. Cody Hackin's testimony has revealed new possibilities in this case. In fact, things may have happened very differently than we previously thought. The Steel Samurai seen by Ms. Oldbag may have been the victim, Jack Hammer. The scene of the crime was not Studio One, but Studio Two. And those in the trailer did have time to commit murder. Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: Your homework is to find the answer to the following question: Why would Mr. Hammer steal the Steel Samurai costume? Also, who killed him, and why? Find the answers for me by tomorrow.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's a lot of homework!)

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mm?

Name: Judge
Text: You will need to reconsider your stance in this case. Above all, you will need to reconsider your suspicion of Mr. Will Powers.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: As you say, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: This trial will be extended until tomorrow. This is the last extension! Very well... Court is adjourned!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whew! That was a close one!

Name: Mia
Text: We were saved by a hair, but that's all that counts. I thought seriously about going home about three times during the trial.

Name: Phoenix
Text: M-me too!

Name: Will
Text: Really? You both seemed so... so confident!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hah! Maybe I should take up a career in acting? I was ready to pronounce you dead about three times back there.

Name: Mia
Text: Me too!

Name: Will
Text: D-dead!?

Name: Mia
Text: Hoh hoh. Of course, we're kidding.

Name: Will
Text: Are you sure?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I wasn't kidding...) Now, Mr. Powers. We have to go make our final investigation. But I promise you, we'll find the true killer by tomorrow's trial!

Name: Will
Text: R-right! Thanks! *sniff*

Name: Phoenix
Text: That was a close one, huh, Mia?

Name: Maya
Text: Really? Too bad, I'm sorry I missed it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ? M-Maya!

Name: Maya
Text: So, what happened?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, I think I've got a pretty good idea who did it. Now all I need is a motive... and proof.

Name: Maya
Text: Wow! Good going, Nick!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Under the "initial trial" system, tomorrow is the last day we have.

Name: Maya
Text: "Initial trial"...? What's that?

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's the new court system they introduced two or three years ago. They had so many cases in the system, they decided to speed the whole process up.

Name: Maya
Text: So, under that system, trials have to end in three days?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah, pretty much. Well, we've no time to waste!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I don't get it, Maya. Why would Mr. Hammer steal the Steel Samurai costume?

Name: Maya
Text: What!? You mean Mr. Hammer was wearing the costume!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah!

Name: Maya
Text: B-but Mr. Hammer was the victim, Nick! Why would he go through the trouble of stealing it?

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's what we have to find out.

Name: Maya
Text: What happened with the director's testimony?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, it's pretty clear that the producer and the director were both in the trailer.

Name: Maya
Text: Huh...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Which means that the killer has to be one of them!

Name: Maya
Text: Really!? Why?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Because the real scene of the crime was Studio Two... where that trailer is!

Name: Maya
Text: Whaaaat!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... was Maya always this excitable?)

Name: Maya
Text: The old windbag sure is quiet today.

Name: Maya
Text: You know, this place is really... peaceful, like this.

Name: Maya
Text: Nick? I think her guard's down...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yeah?

Name: Maya
Text: I bet we could even eat those donuts in the guard station... if we wanted.

Name: Oldbag
Text: ... You eat, you die.

Name: Maya
Text: Whew! She's alive!

Name: Maya
Text: Think back, Nick, to the day of the murder... Mr. Hammer put on the Steel Samurai costume. Then he left from here to go to Studio Two...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Right.

Name: Maya
Text: But why? I wonder if someone called him...? Like the director, or the producer...?

Name: Maya
Text: Hey, Nick... It's Ms. Vasquez! Hello?

Name: Maya
Text: H-E-L-L-O!

Name: Maya
Text: H! E! L! L! O!

Name: Phoenix
Text: M-Maya! You should at least try to be polite...

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... I'm watching the clouds. ...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's all she had to say, apparently...)

Name: Maya
Text: Um, excuse me? Mr. Hammer came here on the day of the murder, and...

Name: Vasquez
Text: Shh.

Name: Vasquez
Text: Perhaps you didn't hear me. I'm watching the clouds. I'm not interested in talking to you.

Name: Maya
Text: Do something, Nick! She's really ticking me off!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh dear...)

Name: Maya
Text: Umm... Mr. Powers wasn't the killer! You don't have to cancel the Steel Samurai!

Name: Vasquez
Text: I think I'm tired of the Steel Samurai.

Name: Maya
Text: You... you did it! Nick! She did it! She's the killer! My Fey blood speaks to me! I know it! I know it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh dear...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, I was wondering if you could tell me about Mr. Manella?

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... If you must talk about that man... Perhaps you could talk about it in the trailer? By yourselves?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh, oh dear...)

Name: Maya
Text: ... Wasn't the assistant cleaning up yesterday? Funny, it still seems pretty messy in here.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I guess she was still on a high from getting that rare card she needed.

Name: Maya
Text: I guess they're not filming today, either. I did want to see them filming... just one time.

Name: Phoenix
Text: This trial will be over and done by tomorrow. You can come see them film later.

Name: Maya
Text: I guess... This is where you found that bottle of sleeping pills, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh huh.

Name: Maya
Text: I wonder if there're any other clues lying around.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaarh! No no no! No touchin'!

Name: Maya
Text: Eeek!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh, sorry, pal. Didn't mean to frighten you.

Name: Maya
Text: D-didn't mean...? I almost had a heart attack!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Heh heh. I guess I can be a little dramatique at times... I suppose it's the actor in me...

Name: Phoenix
Text: ("Dramatique" indeed...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Ahem. Anyway, I'm here to examine the plate on that table.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait, are you looking for sleeping pills?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yeah, pal. Traces thereof.

Name: Maya
Text: So you're looking for traces of the sleeping pills... how?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: For a thorough examination I gotta take the plate back to the precinct. But I have the capabilities to make a cursory examination right here! Our science guy gave me some testing solution. This reacts to sleeping pills, see? If there're traces it'll change color.

Name: Maya
Text: Wow! Neat! Well, Detective Gumshoe? What are you waiting for?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Now, now, everything in due time, pal. ... ... ... Well, the testing solution on the plate changed color alright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So there were sleeping pills on the plate!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: It's looking like Will Powers was drugged... I'm going to go back to the precinct to do some more detailed tests.

Name: Maya
Text: You're being very... free with your information today, Detective.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well... don't go telling anyone this, pal. But I was kind of impressed at today's trial, too.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Most lawyers would've given up after that director's testimony. I think if it'd been anyone but you up there, Powers would be done for by now.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How goes your investigation?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: To tell the truth, it's a real mess, pal. Some people think we should pursue the case we already have against Powers... And some people think we should switch suspects!

Name: Maya
Text: What do you think, Detective Gumshoe?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Well, pal, I hate to admit it... But I'm not sure I buy the case against Mr. Powers any more. I feel kind of bad for Mr. Edgeworth, though.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How is Edgeworth doing, anyway?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Edgeworth is out of control! He was in the waiting room and he crushed this paper cup with hot, hot coffee in it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Whoa...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Talk about burns, pal!

Name: Maya
Text: Wow! The fury of Edgeworth!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah, crushing paper cups... (Cups... bottles...?) Say, what ever happened with that empty bottle?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh, the bottle of sleeping pills? Well, I got some good news for you about that. They found the victim, Jack Hammer's prints on the bottle.

Name: Maya
Text: So that means...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Yep, it sounds like the one who put Powers to sleep was none other than... the victim!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (So I was right!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective, about that bottle...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh, that? Talk about embarrassing, pal! I can't believe I missed that on my first sweep for evidence. Don't know how I can apologize to Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Maya
Text: It must be tough being a detective, with all that responsibility...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh, heh heh. *blush*

Name: Phoenix
Text: Could you tell me more about Ms. Vasquez?

Name: Will
Text: Oh... the producer? She's well respected in the industry. They say she's a genius.

Name: Maya
Text: A genius...?

Name: Will
Text: She's been at Global Studios for five years now. Right or wrong, nobody dares tell her different these days.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why is that?

Name: Will
Text: Ever since she came on board, we've had nothing but hits. Global Studios was on its knees, but she picked it up and made it shine. Oh, and...

Name: Maya
Text: And... what?

Name: Will
Text: N-nothing. Forget it. I... I've only heard rumors, anyhow.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Can you tell me anything about Mr. Manella?

Name: Will
Text: Oh, he used to be a minor straight-to-video director. But something in his work caught Vasquez's eye. She brought the Steel Samurai idea to him. Now everyone knows the name Sal Manella. I hear he's pretty much at her beck and call, though. Whenever she says "jump!" he asks "how high?" and all that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I can imagine him being at her beck and call... though I can't imagine him jumping.)

Name: Maya
Text: I was wondering about Mr. Hammer... He was a big star back in the day, right? But then he just dropped off the face of the Earth.

Name: Will
Text: Oh... Yes, you're right. In fact, he was my role model when I started in this business. But he just stopped taking on big roles. That's when he began appearing in little productions at Global...

Name: Maya
Text: How could he do that!? I was really looking forward to a sequel to "Samurai Summer."

Name: Will
Text: He just gave up being a star five years ago. Actually, now that I think about it... That was right when Ms. Vasquez came to Global.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Five years ago...?)

Name: Penny
Text: Oh! Hello!

Name: Maya
Text: What are you doing here?

Name: Penny
Text: Oh... I was just cleaning up the dressing room. I guess WP won't be using it anymore, so...

Name: Maya
Text: Wha!? What!? Why!? But WP's innocent!

Name: Penny
Text: Yes, and I'm really grateful for all you've done. But... This week is the last episode of the Steel Samurai...

Name: Maya
Text: What!? Nooooooooooooooooo!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I was wondering if I could ask you about Mr. Hammer...

Name: Penny
Text: Yes?

Name: Phoenix
Text: On the day of the murder, he went to Studio Two.

Name: Penny
Text: Huh? I thought he went to Studio One?

Name: Maya
Text: He stole the Steel Samurai costume, too!

Name: Penny
Text: What!? Why would Mr. Hammer do something like that? ... Oh... I guess the rumor must be true, then.

Name: Maya
Text: The rumor?

Name: Penny
Text: Yeah. Mr. Vasquez, that producer, had some kind of hold on Hammer. She had some dirt on him... He'd do anything she said, apparently.

Name: Maya
Text: Some "dirt"? What dirt!

Name: Penny
Text: ... Dirt. You know, bad stuff.

Name: Maya
Text: ... Um, I know what dirt means...

Name: Penny
Text: About five years ago, they were filming a movie starring Mr. Hammer. They were using the new studio... Studio Two. Some sort of accident happened during filming. After that, they never used Studio Two again. They left the film set the way it was, too.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The film set...? Was that trailer part of the film set, then?)

Name: Maya
Text: W-what do you mean, the "last Steel Samurai"!?

Name: Penny
Text: I know it's a shock, but nothing can be done to save it now. Whoever really did kill Mr. Hammer, also signed the Steel Samurai's death warrant.

Name: Maya
Text: No... no!

Name: Penny
Text: Also, I hear that Global Studios is going to change its programming. They're not going to make kids' shows anymore.

Name: Maya
Text: W-what!? Why!?

Name: Penny
Text: I don't know. It's sad, but that's what Global Studios decided.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why aren't they going to make kids' shows anymore?

Name: Penny
Text: The studio bigwigs don't want the Steel Samurai around anymore. They want to forget all this ever happened. They want it quiet, you understand?

Name: Maya
Text: H-how can they just do that! What about all the kids who love the Steel Samurai!

Name: Penny
Text: It's okay. I'm sure the kids will be fine. They'll find a new hero to follow.

Name: Maya
Text: No, that can't be true! If the program just ends, they'll be heartbroken for sure! N-Nick! Say something!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Umm... yeah. (I think evidence, rather than words, is called for here.) Here, take a look at this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Penny
Text: And this is...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: A fan collected all of these photographs. The kids love the Steel Samurai! The show shouldn't be cancelled just so some adults can save face! I would think you would understand that better than anyone.

Name: Penny
Text: ... ... You're right... Okay! But what can I do?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, for starters... You can tell me something. Tell me what it is that Global Studios is so intent on hiding? Tell me about this accident five years ago.

Name: Penny
Text: ... Okay!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Could you tell us what happened five years ago?

Name: Penny
Text: Well, I can tell you what I've heard. Apparently, five years ago, someone died... and it was Hammer's fault.

Name: Maya
Text: S-someone died!?

Name: Penny
Text: It was an accident, of course! Anyway... The producer, Ms. Vasquez managed to hush it up.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And that's the "dirt" she had on Mr. Hammer?

Name: Maya
Text: And that's why Mr. Hammer would do anything Ms. Vasquez asked him to do! ... But, it was an accident, right? Why didn't they just make it public?

Name: Penny
Text: Well, you know Mr. Hammer was a big star back then. They were afraid about what would happen to his career if word got out.

Name: Maya
Text: I see...

Name: Penny
Text: You know who knows more about this? Ms. Oldbag. She was here at the studios back then, you know.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Thanks. We'll try asking her. (If she'll talk...)

Name: Oldbag
Text: What, you're still slinking around? If you like the place so much, why don't you take over for me?

Name: Maya
Text: The old windbag doesn't look so good...

Name: Oldbag
Text: E-everybody's doing their darnedest to forget Hammer. Who do they think made Global Studios what it is today? Hammer! It's all due to Hammer!

Name: Maya
Text: She's starting to froth at the mouth, Nick... Maybe we should keep a safe distance?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Umm... I wanted to ask you about five years ago...

Name: Oldbag
Text: ! Who told!? Who did you hear that from!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I, uh... huh?

Name: Oldbag
Text: Nichols!

Name: Phoenix
Text: N-nickels?

Name: Maya
Text: Nichols, Nick. Penny Nichols. That assistant we talked to.

Name: Phoenix
Text: O-oh, right. Anyway, we heard about the accident. It was during filming with Jack Hammer... He killed a man. Didn't he?

Name: Oldbag
Text: Wh-whippersnappers! Dredging up dirt on someone's past like that... and the recently departed, no less! I suppose you think this is fun!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: N-no, I'm just doing my job to protect Mr. Powers...

Name: Oldbag
Text: And you claim that Hammer stole Powers's costume! You expect me to believe that rubbish!? Or do you have some kind of proof?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Proof that Hammer stole Powers's costume? Hmm...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm sorry Ms. Oldbag, but I do have proof. I can prove that Mr. Hammer stole Mr. Powers's costume.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Powers ate a t-bone steak for lunch, correct?

Name: Oldbag
Text: W-well... yes. So?

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is the plate that he used to eat that steak. There are traces of sleeping pill powder on the plate!

Name: Oldbag
Text: Mmmph? Hah! I-I bet Powers put it in there himself! Even a lightweight like him must have trouble sleeping sometimes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Except, I have proof that Mr. Hammer put the pills in.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: This bottle contained sleeping pills. Mr. Hammer's fingerprints were found on the bottle.

Name: Oldbag
Text: ...! ... ... I see. Poor, poor Hammer. You did wrong, Hammer, rest your soul.

Name: Maya
Text: Ms. Oldbag...?

Name: Oldbag
Text: Okay. You win. I'll talk. I'm tired, see... Tired of holding it all in.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Oldbag...

Name: Oldbag
Text: You're right. Five years ago there was an accident... a fatal accident. What's worse, a paparazzi took a photo of it. That photo, well, it caused quite a stir. And guess who made it all better? Vasquez! She has ties to the mafia... She silenced that paparazzi. That was the beginning. After that, she became a force to be reckoned with here at the studio.

Name: Maya
Text: I see...!

Name: Oldbag
Text: But, you have to understand... Poor old Hammer never meant any harm to anyone!

Name: Maya
Text: Ms. Oldbag...

Name: Oldbag
Text: Hold on a minute.

Name: Maya
Text: Poor Ms. Oldbag...

Name: Oldbag
Text: Here, take this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...? A photograph? W-wait a second!

Name: Oldbag
Text: This is the picture.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Is... this the trailer in Studio Two?

Name: Oldbag
Text: Hammer was supposed to fight with a bad guy on the top of those stairs, there. He pushed the other actor, and the man fell onto the flowerbox fence.

Name: Phoenix
Text: B-but how did you get this?

Name: Oldbag
Text: It... was a long time ago. I don't feel much like talking about it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I understand...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (She's not even looking.)

Name: Vasquez
Text: Where.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Where did you get that?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I, well...

Name: Vasquez
Text: Oldbag.

Name: Phoenix
Text: O-Old...?

Name: Maya
Text: She means the security lady, Ms. Oldbag, Nick.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Right... anyway... Ms. Vasquez. You hid this incident from the press, didn't you? And you used it to control Mr. Hammer!

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... The wind.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The... huh?

Name: Vasquez
Text: It's gotten stronger, don't you think? The wind. ... Your conversation interests me. Let's talk about it more inside the trailer.

Name: Maya
Text: Nick. She went inside the trailer.

Name: Vasquez
Text: Hmph. You came. Well then, what was that you were talking about?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (...! Why is she so eager to talk all of a sudden?) Ms. Vasquez. You were using that accident! You were blackmailing Mr. Hammer so you could control him, weren't you? That's why he was doing kids' shows for petty change!

Name: Vasquez
Text: Hmph... So I'm a blackmailer now?

Name: Maya
Text: Well, that's what it was, wasn't it! I mean, sure, it was an accident... But you used it to drag Mr. Hammer down from his rightful place as a star!

Name: Vasquez
Text: Oh...? I haven't pulled anyone down from anywhere. Mr. Hammer's career went sour of its own accord.

Name: Maya
Text: B-but! You were the cause! You pressured him... And to think it was just an accident...!

Name: Vasquez
Text: Excuse me! What is this all about? You keep saying "accident," "accident"... How are you so sure?

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Must I spell everything out for you? Think: what would it be if it wasn't an accident?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! No... No way! You mean Mr. Hammer did it... on purpose?

Name: Vasquez
Text: That is what I mean.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-where's your proof! Can you prove it!?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Hmph! Just think! Would he have let me run his life for five years... over a mere accident? And I ran him hard, believe you me!

Name: Maya
Text: B-but, the security lady said it was an accident!

Name: Vasquez
Text: Oh. Well, she was a big fan of Hammer's, you see. She jumped on the reporter who brought that photo into the studio. She wrenched it out of his hands, she did. Gave him a few bruises, too.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (... So that's why she had the photo...)

Name: Vasquez
Text: She's an old fool. Of course, all the reporter would need is the negatives. He could have made a copy. But he didn't. The only copy of that photo is the one you hold. Give it to me. Now.

Name: Maya
Text: W-what? This is valuable evidence!

Name: Vasquez
Text: Boys!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... U-umm... Who are they...?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Professionals. They're good at erasing... various things. What do you think...? Would you like to be erased?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Vasquez
Text: The trial ends tomorrow? How unfortunate. It's a shame you'll have to miss it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Tell me why. Why do you want this photograph so badly? This is Mr. Hammer's "dirt"... no? Why should Dee Vasquez care about it at all?

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... I'm sure you'll have plenty of time to think about that where you're going. So long, friends. Boys, erase away.

Name: Maya
Text: Nooooooooooooo!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hold it right there! I heard everything, pal! Dee Vasquez! You're coming down to the precinct with me, now!

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... Hmph. Not bad. ... Very well. It appears this contest will be decided tomorrow then. In court. I'll be looking forward to it.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: H-hey, you okay, pal? Sorry I was a little late with my entrance. I don't get many chances to practice that sorta thing.

Name: Maya
Text: Detective Gumshoe... Thank you thank you thank you! I was really scared...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Huh? Don't mention it, pal. Just doing my job. ... ...

Name: Maya
Text: Detective Gumshoe?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Sorry, it's just... I've wanted to say that line ever since I became a detective. ... Okay. I've got one more job to do today. I'm sure we'll run into each other again soon!

Name: Maya
Text: Well, Nick. It looks like we're getting close to the bottom of this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (And who's at the bottom...? Dee Vasquez!)

Name: Judge
Text: Court is now in session for the trial of Mr. Will Powers.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Today will be the final day of this trial. I hope both the prosecution and the defense will be able to present decisive evidence. Very well, Mr. Edgeworth. Your opening statement.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: In yesterday's session, the defense presented us with a new theory for this case. He claims that the scene of the crime was, in fact, Studio Two. Today, I will call on people present in the Studio Two trailer that day. From their testimonies, the truth will become clear.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... very well!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Edgeworth seems a bit on edge today...)

Name: Judge
Text: You may call your first witness, Mr. Edgeworth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The prosecution calls Ms. Dee Vasquez to the stand. Ms. Dee Vasquez is a producer who was present in the Studio Two trailer that day.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Will the witness state her name and occupation?

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... Dee Vasquez. I am a producer for Global Studios.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: On the day of the murder, you were in the trailer in Studio Two...

Name: Vasquez
Text: As everyone here knows, yes?

Name: Vasquez
Text: I dislike needless banter. If you must pontificate, do it when I'm not here.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mrrph!

Name: Judge
Text: V-very well, Ms. Vasquez. Please give the court your testimony concerning the day of the murder.

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! I know she did it! Make her pay!

Name: Phoenix
Text: R-right! (If she's guilty, I'll catch her with her pants down... So to speak.)

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... I have a question about one part of your testimony. You were "fatigued" so you had Sal "take" you...?

Name: Vasquez
Text: The van.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm?

Name: Vasquez
Text: There's a van at Studio Two. I had him take me in that. I thought it might be risky to walk, what with that monkey's head toppling over.

Name: Judge
Text: I... I see! Very well. Mr. Wright, your cross-examination.

Name: Maya
Text: This is the final battle, Nick! Let's do it!

Name: Vasquez
Text: I entered the trailer, oh, a little before noon.

Name: Phoenix
Text: By yourself?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Yes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And you didn't stop in at the Employee Area?

Name: Vasquez
Text: No.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... Are you always this... terse?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Yes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh dear...)

Name: Vasquez
Text: The meeting began at 12:00 sharp. It ended at 4:00..

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did no one leave during the meeting?

Name: Vasquez
Text: No one. ...

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... C-come on... let's talk a bit more about that.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The witness did not come here to engage in idle conversation! Stop interrupting the testimony.

Name: Vasquez
Text: The same could be said to you, Mr. Edgeworth. And please stop banging on your little desk. It hurts my ears.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mmph!

Name: Vasquez
Text: There was to be a rehearsal afterwards, so we went to Studio One.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And when exactly was that?

Name: Vasquez
Text: I've forgotten.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Maybe you could try remembering?

Name: Vasquez
Text: No.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The meeting ended at 4:00, and the rehearsal was scheduled for 5:00... I would think it was between those times.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (You "would think"!? C'mon, all you did was state the obvious, Edgeworth!)

Name: Vasquez
Text: I was fatigued, so I had Sal take me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hold on! You had Sal "take" you? What does that mean!?

Name: Vasquez
Text: It means what I just said. I had Sal take me in the Studio Two van.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Oh... oh, right.)

Name: Vasquez
Text: At 2:30, we took a 15-minute break in the meeting.

Name: Phoenix
Text: And what were you doing during that time...?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Don't hit your desk. It irritates me.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yeah! Mr. Wright...! Oops.

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... It was a 15 minute break...

Name: Vasquez
Text: Sal and I ate t-bone steaks on the table in front of the trailer.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Do you have someone who can verify this?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Sal.

Name: Phoenix
Text: N-no... I mean someone else?

Name: Vasquez
Text: One person is enough.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (If she committed murder during that break... She wouldn't have had time to eat a t-bone steak! If I had some evidence that proved she didn't eat that steak...)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hah! As I thought!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You claim you ate a t-bone steak! But I say you did not!

Name: Judge
Text: W-what's this, now, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Look at this.

Name: Judge
Text: It's... a plate?

Name: Phoenix
Text: This plate was on the table in the employee room. As you can see, a large bone has been left behind.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mr. Wright. Need I remind you it was a T-BONE STEAK!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Exactly my point! Remember if you will... Ms. Vasquez and Mr. Manella ate at a table outside the trailer. Yet there were no bones left on the plates! The plates were bare!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Vasquez? Tell me, how can a person eat a t-bone steak... and not leave the bone? I think I know how!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You didn't eat any steak during that break! You took your steak and threw it somewhere... like that incinerator!

Name: Judge
Text: I... I see! Then what was Ms. Vasquez doing during her break?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Isnâ€™t it obvious, Your Honor?

Name: Phoenix
Text: She was meeting with the Steel Samurai!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! A-are you saying...!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Your Honor! As Ms. Vasquez left the trailer to eat her steak... She ran into the Steel Samurai! And then you did it. You killed him with your own hands!

Name: Judge
Text: M-Mr. Wright! I-isn't that a little presumptuous!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What kind of stunt are you trying to pull, Wright!?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Let him claim what he wants.... You say I did it?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes.

Name: Vasquez
Text: Fascinating! And here I was worrying that today would be as boring as all the rest. ... Very well. Let us have a battle of wits, you and I.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Any day, Vasquez!)

Name: Maya
Text: Good luck, Nick!

Name: Vasquez
Text: Let's see... What was that murder weapon again? Oh yes, the "Samurai Spear."

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes...?

Name: Vasquez
Text: I am, as you can see, a woman of petite stature. How could I possibly use that heavy spear as a weapon?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I think you would have a great deal of difficulty using that as a weapon. Pretty much anyone would.

Name: Vasquez
Text: Hah. You see?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes...

Name: Phoenix
Text: However, that has no bearing on this case!

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... Meaning?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The Samurai Spear was not the murder weapon!

Name: Vasquez
Text: What!?

Name: Judge
Text: What is the meaning of this!? The spear was found lying next to the victim's body!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I have proof, Your Honor. I can prove that the Samurai Spear was not used as the murder weapon!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: I present my proof: the so-called "murder weapon"!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: B-but, that IS the murder weapon!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Not so fast. Remember that this spear broke during the morning action scene run-through? But, someone fixed the spear. It was the security lady! She fixed it with duct tape! Now tell me, how is it possible... for someone to stab a man who is wearing a thick costume with this!? Through the chest!

Name: Judge
Text: O-order! Order!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mr. Wright! What are you driving at!? Think about what you're--

Name: Vasquez
Text: Silence! Iâ€™m the one testifying here and I will be heard!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mmmph...!

Name: Vasquez
Text: Are you quite sane? Are you even aware of what you're saying? If the Samurai Spear was not the murder weapon, then pray tell what was!? How was Hammer killed?

Name: Judge
Text: Well, Mr. Wright? Can you tell us what weapon was used to kill Mr. Hammer?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Would I make a claim like that if I couldn't tell you what the weapon was?

Name: Judge
Text: Iâ€™m afraid your confidence can sometimes be unfounded, Mr. Wright... Very well, let's see this murder weapon, then.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Look at this photo.

Name: Judge
Text: W-what is this? Why, that's Jack Hammer standing at the top of the stairs! O-order! Order! If I cannot have order this trial will be suspended! Mr. Wright! What is this all about!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: This photograph is from five years ago. There was an unfortunate accident at Global Studios. This is a photo of that very accident. Not a word of this was leaked to the outside. It was a close-kept secret at the studios.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: What does this have to do with the current case!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Edgeworth... You still can't see it? See the fallen man in this photo? See how the fencepost pierced him through the chest?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wh... what!? Are you saying...!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes. What happened five years ago... has happened again!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright! Continue!

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's 2:30 PM on the day of the murder! Ms. Dee Vasquez meets Jack Hammer outside the Studio Two trailer! Then she did it! She pushed Mr. Hammer off the stairs onto the fence! Just like Mr. Hammer had himself done five years ago! Though whether she did it on purpose or by accident, I cannot say.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I-in other words... th-the victim, Mr. Hammer... He died in the same way that he caused another man to die... five years ago!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Precisely. Ironic, isnâ€™t it?

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... Hoh hoh. Very creative, Mr. Wright. I could use a man like you on my script writing staff.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You deny that what I say is true?

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... Mr. Wright. Let's say, for the sake of argument, that Hammer died at the trailer as you say. Yet the body was found at Studio One, was it not? And in the Evil Magistrate's costume, no less. Are you then claiming that I carried the body to Studio One... And returned to the trailer all in the space of a 15 minute break? How could I have disposed of the body!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The break in the meeting at the trailer lasted 15 minutes, from 2:30 to 2:45. Could Jack Hammer have been pushed off the stairs to his death... then carried to Studio One and placed inside his costume? There wasnâ€™t enough time!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... indeed. Well, Mr. Wright? How could she have dealt with the body?

Name: Phoenix
Text: What if she had another way to carry the body, other than with her own hands?

Name: Vasquez
Text: For instance?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Actually, for that matter, there was no need for her to do the deed in 15 minutes! And there was a way for you to carry that body.

Name: Vasquez
Text: !!! I-interesting! Let's hear it then.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright? Please show us how she carried the body.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Ms. Vasquez. You carried the body to Studio One. And you used the studio van to do it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Recall your testimony...

Name: Vasquez
Text: There was to be a rehearsal afterwards, so we went to Studio One. I was fatigued, so I had Sal take me. There was a van there, right? I had Sal drive me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You used the van to carry the body to Studio One! Then, before everyone else got there, you put the body into the Magistrate costume!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hold on, Wright! Don't forget, it was Sal Manella that drove the van! Are you suggesting that Mr. Manella was a conspirator?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Of course, Sal Manella has to have been a conspirator! The body had to be placed in the van, and put into the costume. There's no way Ms. Vasquez could have done that alone! Also, don't forget that they had to dispose of the Steel Samurai costume. They had to... because it was covered in Mr. Hammer's blood! They probably burned it in that small incinerator. Well, Ms. Vasquez! Shall I continue?

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... No need. You're smarter than you look, Mr. Wright. Hmph. I lose. You win. It... was fun.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Umm... So... what happens next?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Don't "?" me! Donâ€™t you have anything to say!?

Name: Vasquez
Text: What would you like me to say?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? "I lost"? Something like that!

Name: Vasquez
Text: I just said that.

Name: Phoenix
Text: W-wait, so you mean... Dee Vasquez! So, it was you? You killed Jack Hammer! ...

Name: Vasquez
Text: Who can say?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Vasquez
Text: Are you sure I did? Mr. Wright... We just engaged in a battle of wits. And the result of that battle? You proved the possibility that I murdered Hammer.

Name: Phoenix
Text: R-right!

Name: Vasquez
Text: But... that is only a possibility. Proof is another thing altogether. You lack decisive proof, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wha... wha... wha... wha... WHAAAAAAAAAT!?

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Mr. Edgeworth, your thoughts?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Umm... uhh... mmmph. O-of course, it's as the witness says! ... Certainly, it does seem very likely she did it... but, uh, there's no proof!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (...! Edgeworth isn't sure!)

Name: Vasquez
Text: ... Well? I came here as a witness today. If you've no more questions, I'll be leaving.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Urk! What do I do now!?)

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I was hoping I'd come up with a question while pounding on my desk. I didn't.

Name: Judge
Text: ... You have my sympathies.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Damn... damn! To come so far, only to fail...)

Name: Judge
Text: As it seems there are no further questions... I would like to end the cross-examination of the witness, Ms. Vasquez.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Judge
Text: Yes, Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I was hoping I'd come up with a question while I was objecting, Your Honor... I didn't.

Name: Judge
Text: I see... Very well.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor! I request that the witness testify again!

Name: Vasquez
Text: You are the prosecutor, are you not? Why are you badgering me? I'm your witness!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I... I just want to hear your testimony again.

Name: Vasquez
Text: Does this make any sense to you, Your Honor? I don't see that we have anything to gain by repeating the last several minutes.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Edgeworth... I, too, see little point in making Ms. Vasquez repeat herself. What exactly did you want her to testify about?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mmmph! Well, yes, um... ... Indeed! Verily, I say... Ergo! I want to hear about what happened... after they found the body!

Name: Judge
Text: After they found the body...? Very well. The witness will testify to the court concerning this matter.

Name: Vasquez
Text: Hmph.

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! Why did Edgeworth...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Who knows? He probably realized she did it, too.

Name: Maya
