Text: Mr. Wright! Please cease these pointless questions! What possible good could knowing what a radio DJ said do us!?

Name: Judge
Text: Indeed, Mr. von Karma has a point. I'll allow the question only if you see some reason why we should care...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: We should care, Your Honor! Of course we should!

Name: Karma
Text: Why?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh. W-well, how do you know if we don't ask, hmm?

Name: Judge
Text: Fine, very well. Mr. Butz, please testify to the court. What was the radio announcer saying when you heard the gunshot?

Name: Butz
Text: Just when she said "Hey! It's almost Christmas!" I heard the gunshot!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you sure?

Name: Butz
Text: Course I am! She had this real sexy voice...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... maybe von Karma was right. I'm not sure how that helped us at all.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Larry! Are you absolutely sure what you're saying is correct!?

Name: Butz
Text: Huh? What's with the face? You look scary, dude. Hey, if you're trying to scare me, you better know I don't scare that easy!

Name: Judge
Text: Is something the matter, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! Did you hear what the witness just said? The DJ said "Hey! It's almost Christmas!" when he heard the gunshot!

Name: Judge
Text: Indeed... And...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: "Almost Christmas" means it wasn't Christmas! Do you realize what this means? When he heard the gunshot, it was still Christmas Eve!!!

Name: Judge
Text: That would seem to be the case, yes...

Name: Phoenix
Text: But that contradicts the two testimonies we have heard, Your Honor! Both Ms. Hart and the old man said it was after midnight when they heard the shots! In other words... When they heard the gunshots, it was already Christmas!!!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is the most ludicrous testimony I've ever heard. But there is one gleaming ray of hope in there! I've got to press it until we get to the bottom of what happened!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is a clear contradiction, Your Honor!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! What does this mean? The two prior witnesses heard gunshots after midnight. However, this witness says he heard a gunshot before midnight...

Name: Karma
Text: Judge. The answer is simple. The current witness is plainly mistaken. Just look at him! Suspicious!

Name: Butz
Text: Wh-whaaat!?

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Well, Mr. Wright? What do you think about Mr. Butz's claim that he heard the gunshot before midnight?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Larry's not mistaken, Your Honor! He heard that gunshot before midnight!

Name: Karma
Text: ... Intriguing. I'm assuming you have evidence for this wild claim? Show me evidence there was a gunshot before midnight!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Look at this photograph! This was taken by our witness yesterday, Ms. Lotta Hart, with her automatic camera. The timestamp on the photo reads "December 24, 11:50 PM."

Name: Judge
Text: Oh yeah? Hmm? But, there's nothing on the lake in this picture.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor. The real issue here is not why nothing is shown in the photograph. It is why this photograph exists at all!

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor... This photograph was taken by an automatic camera. That camera was set to go off in response to loud noises!

Name: Judge
Text: Ahah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Correct! There was a loud noise on the lake at 11:50 PM. That is why this photograph was taken! In other words... When Larry heard that gunshot, it was most definitely Christmas Eve!

Name: Judge
Text: Indeed, it would seem that is the case! Then... where does that leave us? Ms. Hart testified that she heard the gunshots after midnight. Are you claiming she was mistaken?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Not at all, Your Honor. It is a fact that the camera also triggered at 15 minutes after midnight! Your Honor! That night, there were two sets of gunshots, with a 25 minute pause between them!

Name: Judge
Text: Why would this be...?

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Don't be fooled, Judge! That camera was set to respond to "loud noises"!

Name: Judge
Text: Yes?

Name: Karma
Text: There is no proof that the "loud noise" at 11:50 was a gunshot! Why, the witness could have sneezed, triggering the camera!

Name: Butz
Text: H-hey, my noise was clear that night, man! Clear!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Well, Mr. Wright? There's no turning back now. Can you prove that the "loud noise" at 11:50 PM was indeed a gunshot? Please show the court evidence if you have any.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is my evidence.

Name: Judge
Text: The... murder weapon?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Something about this pistol was bothering me, Your Honor. Both of the witnesses who testified yesterday heard two gunshots. However, the murder weapon was fired three times. When, then, was the last shot fired? Only now have I realized the truth. That third shot was the shot Larry heard just before midnight!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Hmm... That would make sense of the evidence we've seen so far. ... However... This leaves me wondering exactly what did happen that night on the lake.

Name: Karma
Text: Exactly! If this is true, there were two sets of gunshots, separated by 25 minutes! One at 11:50, another at 15 minutes after midnight! Why, I ask you! Why!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh, I'd better think of something quick! ... Wait a second...! Gunshots separated by 25 minutes...?) Aaaaaaaaaaah!

Name: Maya
Text: Wh-what's wrong, Nick?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I have it! I have it!

Name: Maya
Text: Huh?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Remember the case with the Steel Samurai!?

Name: Maya
Text: Huh? Yeah, of course I remember...

Name: Phoenix
Text: The murderer in this case had the same idea as the murderer in that case!

Name: Maya
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Maya!

Name: Maya
Text: Yes!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: If we don't figure this out now, we'll never overturn Edgeworth's guilty verdict! I've got a hunch, and I'm going to run with it...

Name: Maya
Text: Right! I mean... is this safe?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Safe? We've already gotten a guilty verdict! We have nothing to lose!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You just watch and let me know if I say anything that sounds fishy, okay?

Name: Maya
Text: Right, Nick!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor!

Name: Judge
Text: Y-yes, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The testimony just now has cleared up this entire case!

Name: Judge
Text: What do you mean, Mr. Wright!?

Name: Karma
Text: Tsk tsk tsk... So, you've finally realized the truth? There can be no other murderer here than Miles Edgeworth himself.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wrong, von Karma! A man was shot that night, but it wasn't Edgeworth who did the shooting!

Name: Karma
Text: Listen, rookie. Take a deep breath, and consider the facts. At the time of the murder, one boat was on the lake. This was shown by the witness's photograph. The defendant, Edgeworth, and victim, Robert Hammond, were on that boat. There was a gunshot fired on that boat, and Robert Hammond fell into the lake. The distance of the shooting was one meter. It couldn't have been suicide! Well? The guilty party has to be the other man on that boat!

Name: Judge
Text: I admit, it is hard to imagine any other possibility.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes... But this assumes that the victim was shot at 15 minutes after midnight.

Name: Judge
Text: ... What do you mean by that, Mr. Wright? We have photographic evidence of the time of the shooting. The timestamp on the photo says 00:15.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But Larry heard a gunshot 25 minutes before that! Robert Hammond was killed then! 25 minutes before the shot on the lake! (That's the only way that Edgeworth could be innocent!)

Name: Karma
Text: ... Mr. Wright. Are you quite mad? Explain who this is sitting on the boat!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Of course, it was Edgeworth and the murderer! After the murderer killed Robert Hammond at 11:50... He assumed the guise of Mr. Hammond and met Edgeworth!

Name: Judge
Text: Wh... What!? Are you serious?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes. Edgeworth won't tell us why he went to the lake that night. However, I have a hunch. That night, Robert Hammond called Edgeworth to the lake. Now, Edgeworth didn't know Robert Hammond's face that well. That's why he didn't suspect anything when the murderer took Robert Hammond's place!

Name: Judge
Text: ... I'm not sure what to make of all this.

Name: Karma
Text: L-Ludicrous!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright. Tell us the name of the murderer then!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The murderer's name...? Right! It's...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Actually, I don't know the murderer's name.

Name: Judge
Text: Y-you don't know!?

Name: Karma
Text: Bah! Again, you waste my time!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I don't know because he never told us!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The murderer is the caretaker of the boat shop, that old man! At 11:50, he was the one who killed Robert Hammond.

Name: Judge
Text: The caretaker of the boat shop!? Wh-where did he do this!? There weren't any boats on the lake then!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Why would he have to go all the way out on the lake just to shoot someone? May I suggest... That the real scene of the crime was not in a boat!

Name: Judge
Text: What!? W-well then, where did the murder take place!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Show the judge where the murder really took place!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Here, of course! The boat shop, where he lives. That way he could meet with the victim without anyone seeing!

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Do you have proof that the boat shop was the scene of the crime!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Recall Larry's testimony if you will. That night he was out on the lake in a boat, searching for something. He finds it, and returns the boat. Then, just as he's starting to head for home, he hears a gunshot! He heard a gunshot, Your Honor! Even though he was wearing headphones at the time! In other words, the gunshot was very, very close by! And where would that be if he had just returned a boat?

Name: Judge
Text: The boat shop...! Mr. Wright! What happened that night on Gourd Lake!? Please tell the court, from the beginning!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yes, Your Honor.

Name: Maya
Text: Nick, are you sure about this...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, not really. But, I think if I start at the very beginning... And I take it slow, I must just be able to figure this out...

Name: Phoenix
Text: That night... The caretaker of the boat shop called Robert Hammond to his shop. This was around 11:50. That was when the gunshot that Larry heard was fired. After that, the caretaker put on Robert Hammond's coat... He became Robert Hammond! Then he got in the boat with Edgeworth, and went out into the middle of the lake.

Name: Judge
Text: Then... who fired the pistol on the boat, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Of course, it was the murderer who shot the pistol. He shot twice. Both missed Edgeworth, on purpose.

Name: Judge
Text: Wait a minute...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Y-yes?

Name: Judge
Text: Why would he shoot twice if he didn't mean to hit anyone?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... (Details! Details!)

Name: Karma
Text: Know this, Mr. Wright. The moment you run out of explanations is the moment you lose. Tell us why the murderer had to fire twice!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I believe he shot twice to create a witness, Your Honor.

Name: Judge
Text: Create a witness...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The murderer lifts his pistol and fires one shot. That ensures that anyone who heard the shot would look at the lake. Indeed, Ms. Hart did exactly that after hearing the first gunshot. Next! The murderer waits a bit and he fires again. Then... The murderer jumps from the boat himself! Leaving the pistol in the boat behind him.

Name: Judge
Text: ... I see! To someone looking from the edge of the lake... It would appear that one of the men on the boat had shot the other!

Name: Phoenix
Text: The murderer didn't know about the automatic camera, of course. That's why he shot twice to draw attention to the boat!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Once you realize that, everything else falls into place! The boat shop caretaker swam back to his shop. Then he put Mr. Hammond's coat back on the body. And threw the body into the lake! This is what happened, Your Honor. These are the events that transpired that night on Gourd Lake.

Name: Judge
Text: ... Bailiff! Bring out the witness from before! The boat shop caretaker! Quickly!

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. While we are waiting for the caretaker... I would like to ask the defendant, Miles Edgeworth, a few questions. Mr. Edgeworth. Please take the stand.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Edgeworth... You heard what the defense has said?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes.

Name: Judge
Text: Well? Why did you go to the lake that night?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... What Wright has said was mostly correct. Astonishingly so, actually. Yes... Several days ago, I received a letter. The letter was signed, "Robert Hammond." He asked me to come to the boat shop by the lake at midnight on Christmas Eve. He said he had something very important to discuss with me.

Name: Judge
Text: Something important?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I'm sorry. I can't say what it was.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm...

Name: Guard
Text: Your Honor, sir!

Name: Judge
Text: Bailiff! We are conducting a trial here, I ask that you remain quiet...

Name: Guard
Text: The witness has disappeared! He isn't at the boat shop, either!

Name: Judge
Text: What!?

Name: Guard
Text: What should I do?

Name: Judge
Text: F-find him, quickly! We cannot allow him to get away!

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. von Karma! Your witness has disappeared!

Name: Karma
Text: ... A search warrant has already been issued.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... It goes without saying that I cannot declare a verdict under these circumstances. I will extend the trial until tomorrow, the final day allowed. I request that the police department utilize all its forces to find that witness! Am I understood?

Name: Judge
Text: One more thing. Just who is that boat shop caretaker? I think his identity has become very important to this trial. I want him, and I want to know who he is.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. Court is adjourned!

Name: Maya
Text: Yay, Nick! You did it!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah... Well, at least we got out from under that guilty verdict...

Name: Maya
Text: And what about Larry! That was something else! Even von Karma didn't know what to do with his testimony! Larry really helped us out!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Sure, once I sifted through his "unique" testimony. Still... he did save us. I just wish our cases weren't so down to the wire all the time.

Name: Maya
Text: I know what you mean. Sometimes I feel like it's us on trial instead of our clients!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hey, Edgeworth...

Name: Maya
Text: Umm... Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ! D-did you say something?

Name: Maya
Text: Don't look so pained! I mean, it looks like you're probably going to get off the hook! You could try to smile just a little...? Relax!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I'm sorry... But... I fear it's not over for me yet.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what do you mean?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wright... There's something that's been troubling me for a long time now. And I don't know whether or not to tell you...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No... there's so little time left. I want to tell you, to get it off my chest, but... ... Hmm. I can't make up my mind. ...

Name: Phoenix
Text: What is this about, Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... It's... a nightmare I've had. A memory of a crime... that I committed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A crime you committed?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: A memory... of a murder.

Name: Maya
Text: What was Mr. Edgeworth talking about...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: A memory of a crime... that I committed. A memory... of a murder.

Name: Maya
Text: Do you really think Mr. Edgeworth killed...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... I don't believe it. Not Edgeworth. Some painful memory has been troubling him recently... But he'd never take someone's life! Never!

Name: Maya
Text: Nick...

Name: Butz
Text: Yo! How's everyone doing? Whaddya think of my performance today? I had 'em swooning in the aisles! Huh, Maya?

Name: Maya
Text: S-swooning? Me? Oh... Oh, yes. I do remember feeling faint.

Name: Butz
Text: Right on! Tell me the truth, it was like love at first sight, right? Right, Nick?

Name: Phoenix
Text: H-huh? Me!? I... uh, well, maybe my heart skipped a beat or two...

Name: Butz
Text: ... I think you can do better than that! C'mon! I saved Edgeworth in there, dude! Edgey! You guys should be bowing before me! Yeah! Bow before your hero!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Larry... You really helped out in the trial today.

Name: Maya
Text: You did! If you weren't there, Larry, I'm sure Mr. Edgeworth would have been found guilty!

Name: Butz
Text: Hah hah hah hah hah hah hah hah hah hah hah hah! But, seriously, Nick. That boat shop caretaker guy is pretty suspicious... But Edgey ain't off the hook yet!

Name: Maya
Text: Way to spoil the mood, Larry.

Name: Butz
Text: Hey, I'm just a guy sitting in the audience, you know? But from where I was sitting, Edgey seemed pretty... edgy. I mean, can you really know he's telling the truth about that night?

Name: Maya
Text: Nick?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I don't know. But... what I do know is... I'm going to believe in you two until the end.

Name: Butz
Text: Us two?

Name: Maya
Text: Edgeworth and... who else? You mean me right?

Name: Butz
Text: Nah! He means me! Right, Nick?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah, you, Larry.

Name: Maya
Text: Not... me? ... B-but why you, Larry!?

Name: Butz
Text: Huh? Um, actually, yeah. Why me, Nick?

Name: Maya
Text: Hmph. Enough with the silent treatment!

Name: Maya
Text: Nick... Why do you trust Mr. Edgeworth so much? I mean, he's changed recently, true. But when we first met him, he was kind of jerk, don't ya think?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... You didn't know him back then. Back when he wanted to become a defense attorney.

Name: Maya
Text: Wait... Was that when you two were classmates?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes. In grade school... They saved me... Miles... And Larry. They saved me and I'll never forget it. That's why I became a defense attorney, you know.

Name: Maya
Text: Whaaaat!? Hey, hey, Larry. What's he talking about?

Name: Butz
Text: Huh? Uh... umm... Er, sorry. I kinda forgot.

Name: Maya
Text: Hmph. Okay, Nick. Out with it! I'm going to hear this story today, and that's final!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Okay, okay. It's kind of a long story, so hang in there. ... It was the beginning of Spring, 4th grade. I was on trial. A class trial.

Name: Maya
Text: A c-class trial!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You remember, Larry? Spring, 4th grade? A kid in my class got his lunch money stolen.

Name: Maya
Text: Lunch money?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Our school was really small. Every month, kids would bring in an envelope with money for lunch from home.

Name: Maya
Text: Huh, I see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Anyway, this kid's envelope disappeared. With $38.00 still inside.

Name: Butz
Text: Oh... Yeah, now that you mention it, I do remember that!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I can see why you'd forget, though. You were out of school that day. Anyway, the envelope had been stolen during PE class. I was coming down with a cold, so I'd skipped PE that day. I was the only one not in class.

Name: Maya
Text: So... they thought you did it?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah. The kids in class said I should be put on trial.

Name: Maya
Text: Trial...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: So the next day we held a classroom trial, with me as the defendant.

Name: Phoenix
Text: "I... I didn't do it!"

Name: Teacher
Text: "Now, Phoenix, you know you shouldn't steal people's money! It's not right."

Name: Phoenix
Text: In the end, even the teacher thought I'd done it.

Name: Teacher
Text: "Apologize to the class, Phoenix."

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... I didn't know what was happening. I was so sad... I couldn't stop crying. Everyone was staring at me like I'd done it... I tried to apologize. I went over to where the boy was sitting... ... That's when it happened.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Edgeworth
Text: "He shouldn't have to apologize! The only thing that belongs in a trial is evidence! Anything else has no place! You should all be ashamed... amateurs!"

Name: Teacher
Text: "M-Miles?"

Name: Edgeworth
Text: "It wasn't you who stole my money, was it?"

Name: Edgeworth
Text: "Then you shouldn't apologize! Everyone's been shouting you did it, but no one has any proof! That is why, Your Honor, this boy is innocent!"

Name: Teacher
Text: "B-but Miles, it was your money that was stolen!"

Name: Butz
Text: "Why don't you all just shut up!!!"

Name: Butz
Text: "This is always how it is, everybody ganging up and picking on one person. Just think how he feels! He said he didn't do it, so he didn't do it!"

Name: Teacher
Text: "Very well. I will replace the money myself. This class trial is over."

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's how it happened. After that, the three of us were always friends.

Name: Maya
Text: Wow... I had no idea!

Name: Butz
Text: Yeah... I had no idea, either! I mean, I forgot.

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's what I learned what it meant to be alone. Totally alone, without a friend in the world.

Name: Maya
Text: You did a good thing, Larry!

Name: Butz
Text: Um, yeah, well... I was just lucky that I took the day off from school. If I'd been there they would have thought I'd done it! So, I took it kind of personally, see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: ("When something smells, it's usually the Butz.")

Name: Phoenix
Text: Anyway, Edgeworth and I talked after that class trial. That's when I heard his father was a defense attorney. I remember, his eyes would shine when he talked about his father.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: "I'm going to become a defense attorney, just like my Dad! A famous defense attorney!"

Name: Phoenix
Text: Then, a few months later, he suddenly transferred to another school.

Name: Maya
Text: The DL-6 Incident...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Right. I'm not sure, but the transfer probably had to do with his father's death.

Name: Maya
Text: That's so sad!

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... It was several years later when I heard Edgeworth's name again. There was an article about him in the newspaper. The headline was something like "Dark Suspicions of a Demon Attorney." Fabricating evidence, manipulating testimonies, covering up facts... The article said he'd do anything to get a guilty verdict. Anything.

Name: Butz
Text: But why? What happened!? I mean, that's not the Edgey I used to know at all!

Name: Phoenix
Text: That's what I thought too. I tried to get in touch with him I don't know how many times... He never replied.

Name: Maya
Text: I guess he didn't want to see his old friends...

Name: Phoenix
Text: I couldn't just drop it, though. I wanted to meet him, to know why he had become who he became. That's when I decided.

Name: Maya
Text: ...! Wait... You don't mean...? That's why!? That's why you became a defense attorney!? To meet Edgeworth!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: If I was a defense attorney, I knew he's have to meet me whether he wanted to or not. In court. ... Edgeworth believed in me, and I believe in him. He's in pain... And no one's on his side. I'm the only one who knows the real Edgeworth. I'm the only one who can help him.

Name: Butz
Text: Whoa... Nick. S-so, is that why you helped me out for free?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... yes. I helped you because I believed in you. (Except I don't remember saying I'd do it for free...)

Name: Butz
Text: Aw, Nick! Nick!!!

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! We have to save Mr. Edgeworth if it's the last thing we do, okay?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Right. (It very well may be...)

Name: Maya
Text: First, there's that rental boat shop caretaker. We need to find out who or what he is!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'd settle for who. (I guess I can clean out some of this evidence I no longer need... ...) Okay, let's go!

Name: Phoenix
Text: You look grim as always.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmph.

Name: Maya
Text: Um, Mr. Edgeworth? I heard the story about the class trial...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Class trial? What do you mean?

Name: Maya
Text: You... don't remember?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: No, I don't.

Name: Maya
Text: Your lunch money was stolen, wasn't it? In 4th grade...?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Lunch money...? ... Oh... Oh, right. Yes, I seem to remember something like that.

Name: Maya
Text: Nick. I think you're the only one who really remembers.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, it probably only really mattered to me anyway.

Name: Maya
Text: Mr. Edgeworth, didn't you know? That trial was the reason Nick became a defense attorney!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Ridiculous!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Gee... thanks.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That said... It does sound like that kind of thing you'd do. You haven't changed a bit, have you, Wright? So...simple. To a fault, even.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well, maybe yeah, but... I think you changed too much, Edgeworth.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Perhaps.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hey, Edgeworth. Why did you become a prosecutor, anyway? You used to look up to your dad... You said you wanted to be a defense attorney, right?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... I couldn't let myself deny reality like you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: My father was taken from me, and you want me to defend criminals? I'm sorry, Wright, but I'm not that good of a person!

Name: Maya
Text: One suspect was apprehended in your father's murder, right?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes. The man trapped in the elevator with my father. His name... was Yanni Yogi. He had to be the shooter, any way you look at it! Yet... he was found innocent. That defense attorney got him off the hook!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That would be Robert Hammond...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: On that day, 15 years ago... The three of us were trapped in that elevator for five hours. When we were rescued, we all suffered oxygen deprivation. I had lost all memory of the murder.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Lost your memory?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Even now, I can't recall what happened in that elevator. That was the crux of Yogi's argument in court. He claimed Yanni Yogi had been "not of sound mind" due to the oxygen deprivation. Yogi was released due to a lack of evidence... innocent. That's when I changed my mind. I started to hate defense attorneys.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What's your relationship with von Karma?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: He's my teacher, and a man who deserves respect. I learned everything I know of courtroom techniques from him.

Name: Maya
Text: So, he's like my sister was to you, Nick.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: He is a perfectionist in all things. In court... In his personal life... He is obsessed with doing everything perfectly.

Name: Maya
Text: Perfectly, huh?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: In all the cases he has taken on, none were left unsolved. And not one suspect was declared innocent. Ever.

Name: Maya
Text: But... but that's...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I know. It's possible some of the suspects were indeed innocent. However, it is impossible for us to accurately determine that in every case. All von Karma does is his job, to find the suspect guilty, perfectly. In any case... It's nigh well impossible to find a weakness in him. Should a weakness appear, he would do everything in his power to make it go away.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Um, Edgeworth? If what you're saying is true, you're headed for a guilty sentence tomorrow!

Name: Maya
Text: H-he's right! Now's no time to be praising the enemy, Mr. Edgeworth!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Mmph... It's a strange situation in which I find myself, I'll admit.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (No kidding.)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Hey, pal! Long time no see!

Name: Maya
Text: Oh! Detective Gumshoe!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Close one today, eh! I got so worked up, I snapped my tie in half!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh... Sorry about that.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: No prob, pal! Thanks to you, we now know who really did it!

Name: Maya
Text: You mean, the boat shop caretaker?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Look, I'll make you a promise. I'll have that scoundrel in my custody by trial time tomorrow! Come what may! It's my duty to you as a police officer! Now, I'm off to catch me a criminal!

Name: Maya
Text: ... Detective Gumshoe sure is... active today.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Oh, one other thing!

Name: Maya
Text: Eek!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: No one can go into the woods today.

Name: Maya
Text: The woods?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Where Lotta was camping?)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: The woods are off-limits to camping, and apparently the park ranger found out. He got pretty mad. No one can go in for a while.

Name: Maya
Text: I guess Lotta's in a 'lotta' trouble...

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Anyway, I'll be seeing you tomorrow!

Name: Maya
Text: That old caretaker got away...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yep.

Name: Maya
Text: I never imagined he might be the real murderer! ...

Name: Grossberg
Text: *Ah-HHHHEM!*

Name: Phoenix
Text: ...! (I'd know that clearing-of-the-throat anywhere!)

Name: Grossberg
Text: Ah hah, hello! What might you be doing here? Out for a walk, hmm? "Ahh... the days of my youth... like the scent of fresh lemon..." you see.

Name: Maya
Text: Mr. Grossberg! This is no time for idle reminiscing! Mr. Edgeworth's trial ends tomorrow!

Name: Grossberg
Text: Er... that is true, yes. But, from what I saw of today's trial, Edgeworth should be fine, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well... I'm not so sure about that.

Name: Grossberg
Text: Ho ho! What do you mean by that?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Well... I'm not sure.

Name: Grossberg
Text: Hmm... If you find anything out, come by my office at once. I may be able to offer you some assistance.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Thanks... (Bye...)

Name: Maya
Text: What do you think Mr. Grossberg was doing here anyway?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Who knows...

Name: Maya
Text: Nobody's home.

Name: Parrot
Text: "Hello! Hello!" *squawk*

Name: Maya
Text: Hey! It's Polly! I wonder where your owner's gone, Polly?

Name: Parrot
Text: "Hello! Hello!" *squawk*

Name: Maya
Text: I can't believe he'd run off and leave his poor parrot to fend for herself!

Name: Parrot
Text: "Hello! Hello!" *squawk*

Name: Maya
Text: That reminds me, Nick! Polly here knows the number to this safe, right?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah, that's right.

Name: Maya
Text: Polly, what's the number to the safe?

Name: Parrot
Text: "1228"! *squawk*

Name: Maya
Text: Let's open it, Nick! C'mon!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm sure there isn't any money in there.

Name: Maya
Text: Aww... But, hey! He keeps it locked, right? So there must be something of value in there!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm not so sure...

Name: Maya
Text: Okay, Nick, let's see what's in there!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I guess there might be a clue or two...) ... The only thing in here is a letter.

Name: Maya
Text: A letter? Aww... boring!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Hmm... There's no name or signature on this thing. It's handwritten in very precise, clear letters...) ... "Get your revenge on Miles Edgeworth..." Edgeworth!

Name: Maya
Text: N-N-Nick! Why would Mr. Edgeworth's name be on here...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: How should I know!? I'm going to read the whole thing...!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The rest of the letter goes on to describe the murder plot in detail! How to kill Robert Hammond, and frame Edgeworth... ...Calling Edgeworth out to the lake, getting on the boat... firing twice! This is exactly what I figured out today in court! It's all here... in perfect detail!) ...

Name: Maya
Text: What do you think it means, Nick?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I don't know... but it looks like these are instructions for that caretaker. When he killed Robert Hammond and called out Edgeworth, he was following instructions!

Name: Maya
Text: But who could have written that letter? And... what does it mean, to "get revenge on Miles Edgeworth"...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Look, I don't know, okay? But one thing's for certain. This letter is an amazing clue!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Edgeworth... See this letter?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Hmm?

Name: Phoenix
Text: This came out of the safe in the shack where that boat rental caretaker lives.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I see... ...! Revenge... on me?

Name: Maya
Text: Who is that old guy, anyway!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I... I don't know.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Could he be an innocent defendant you got declared guilty or something?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Nice, Wright. But I don't remember that old man. Not at all.

Name: Maya
Text: So, he was following this letter, then?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Which means there was someone else behind it!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Two men... meaning myself and Robert Hammond?

Name: Maya
Text: It also says: "This is your last chance!"

Name: Phoenix
Text: Last chance...? Wait, maybe... Maybe he's talking about the statute of limitations on the DL-6 Incident!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Wait... Wait, that old man...!

Name: Maya
Text: Wh-what is it!? Do you know who he is!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yogi... Could he be Yogi!?

Name: Maya
Text: Yogi?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: The suspect in the DL-6 Incident. The one who was found innocent.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yanni Yogi was a court bailiff at the time. We just happened to be in that elevator together 15 years ago. The quake was incredibly strong... Before I knew it, everything was dark. We were there for so long, it felt like forever. The air thinned... and the darkness closed in on us in that little box. We became... unsettled.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That's all I remember... When I came to, I was in a hospital bed, staring up at the ceiling.In court, Yanni Yogi's mental condition was called into question. They claimed the oxygen deprivation and stress had caused temporary insanity. In the end, the claim passed the court, and Yogi was found innocent.

Name: Maya
Text: Huh... But, isn't that strange? This letter tells him to "get revenge on Edgeworth"... Why would he want to take revenge on you?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: There's something that's been troubling me these last few days. I... didn't know whether or not I should tell you.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You mean the nightmare?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's... a nightmare I've had. A memory of a crime... that I committed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A crime you committed?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ...A memory... of a murder.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I think... I think the time has come to tell all.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: For the last 15 years, I've had the same dream almost every night. I wake up in a fearful sweat, every time.

Name: Maya
Text: What kind of dream?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It's a dream about my father's killing... in the dark.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Then I see the pistol lying by my feet. I don't know if it was evidence from that day in court, or the bailiff's... In a daze, I pick up the pistol...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: (Get away...! Get away from my father!)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: And with that scream... I wake. It's a bone-chilling scream. A scream that has rung in my ears for the past 15 years.

Name: Maya
Text: ... B-but... That's just a dream, right? Right?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... That thought is the only thing that has kept me sane for the last 15 years. But what if I'm wrong? What if it's real? They say that sometimes people shut out memories in self-defense. Maybe it was I who killed my father!

Name: Maya
Text: What!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: If you think about it that way, this letter makes sense. "Get your revenge on Miles Edgeworth." Think about it. Yogi was really innocent. That's why he wanted revenge against me!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait, Edgeworth! You... you mean...!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: It was me. I was the true criminal of DL-6. I shot my father!

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is bad...

Name: Maya
Text: What are we doing to do, Nick? What can we do!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I don't know... I don't think there is anything we can do. Like it or not. If there's someone else who knows a lot about the DL-6 Incident, maybe...

Name: Maya
Text: ...! There is, Nick! There is someone else who knows about DL-6!

Name: Phoenix
Text: M-Mr. Grossberg!

Name: Grossberg
Text: Ah, hello there. What's wrong? You look troubled.

Name: Maya
Text: No kidding! I can't believe you're not!

Name: Grossberg
Text: M-my my my... Just calm down and tell me what's happened, hmm?

Name: Maya
Text: It's M-Mr. Edgeworth! He... He... *sob*

Name: Grossberg
Text: I see... So, Edgeworth dreamt he shot his own father?

Name: Maya
Text: It's o-only a dream! Only a dream!

Name: Grossberg
Text: ... I wonder...

Name: Maya
Text: W-what...?

Name: Grossberg
Text: If that's the case, then why do you two look so troubled, hmm?

Name: Maya
Text: W-well...

Name: Grossberg
Text: Also, consider this. Yogi quite certainly holds a deep grudge against Miles Edgeworth. So deep, he'd want to frame him for murder. This leads me to surmise... That Mr. Edgeworth's dream was NOT a dream. It was real. As you imagined. Miles Edgeworth threw the pistol to save his father... the pistol fired... and the deed was done. ...

Name: Maya
Text: N... No! I don't believe it!

Name: Grossberg
Text: Yogi was suspected of murder, and his career as bailiff was irrevocably wrecked. Thus, he sought revenge on Miles Edgeworth. This was his last chance, of course, with the statute of limitations so close.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you know about Edgeworth's father?

Name: Grossberg
Text: ... He was a defense attorney without peer. It sounds trite, but it's true. Well, he may have had one peer now that I think about it. Your mentor, Mia Fey.

Name: Maya
Text: My sister...?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Gregory Edgeworth was very disapproving of Mr. von Karma's techniques.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That's no surprise...)

Name: Grossberg
Text: von Karma is an extreme man. Forged testimonies and evidence are nothing to him. The result: he has a perfect win record in court. To beat him, Gregory Edgeworth tried to call attention to his methods.

Name: Maya
Text: And...?

Name: Grossberg
Text: He lost. And died in despair, as it were.

Name: Maya
Text: I see...

Name: Grossberg
Text: When Gregory Edgeworth was killed, the police called on a spirit medium. That was your mother, Misty Fey.

Name: Gregory
Text: "I am Gregory Edgeworth... I have been killed... The one who shot me... was the bailiff... Yanni Yogi."

Name: Grossberg
Text: Yet Yogi was found innocent.

Name: Maya
Text: That's when my mother left us. Everyone called her a fraud.

Name: Grossberg
Text: That's right. Everyone thought she was, you see. Yet... now that I think about it. It seem the one who lied was Gregory Edgeworth's ghost... Gregory Edgeworth must have known who shot him.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I don't believe it... So you're saying he falsified his "testimony"? That Edgeworth's dad lied to protect his son...?

Name: Grossberg
Text: It's only a possibility, mind you. But... a possibility nonetheless.

Name: Grossberg
Text: So this is the letter? It does seem that Yogi was following this letter... when he killed Hammond.

Name: Maya
Text: But, why kill Robert Hammond?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Hammond was a skilled defense attorney. But... he defended clients not for their sake, but for his own.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? His own sake?

Name: Grossberg
Text: He never trusted his clients, that one. The only thing he trusted was his own ability.

Name: Maya
Text: But, he got his client found innocent. So why should it matter?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Actually, my dear, it's quite different. He won that innocent verdict for no one but himself. Yogi was a free man, but socially, he was ruined.

Name: Grossberg
Text: You'll understand soon enough. ... Wait!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What is it?

Name: Grossberg
Text: This letter... I've seen this handwriting somewhere before... a long time ago! Whose handwriting was this...? Do you have any idea who wrote this?

Name: Grossberg
Text: If it truly was von Karma who wrote this letter, then he would know the truth. He would know that Miles Edgeworth had accidentally killed his own father.

Name: Grossberg
Text: He'll say as much tomorrow in court, I should think. He'll press the point until the court finds Miles Edgeworth "guilty."

Name: Phoenix
Text: Oh no!

Name: Maya
Text: B-but how could von Karma know about Mr. Edgeworth's past like that? Even Mr. Edgeworth thought it was just a nightmare!

Name: Grossberg
Text: Hmm... That, I do not know. Yet I do know that von Karma is both persistent... and a perfectionist. He may be seeking to satisfy a grudge against Gregory Edgeworth by hurting his son.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What do you mean?

Name: Grossberg
Text: It was fifteen years ago... von Karma met Gregory Edgeworth in court, and von Karma did win... But he didn't make it through the trial unscarred.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What happened in the trial between Edgeworth's dad and von Karma?

Name: Grossberg
Text: von Karma got the "guilty" verdict he wanted. He won the trial. But Gregory Edgeworth accused von Karma of faulty evidence. And though he lost the trial, Mr. Edgeworth's accusation stood.

Name: Maya
Text: Faulty evidence?

Name: Grossberg
Text: It was the only penalty von Karma has ever received in his career as a prosecutor. Gregory Edgeworth dealt a blow to his perfect trial record.

Name: Maya
Text: Wow.

Name: Grossberg
Text: It must have been quite a shock for von Karma. He took a vacation for several months after that, you see.

Name: Phoenix
Text: A vacation...?

Name: Grossberg
Text: Yes, an unusual event for the man. That was the first, and the last vacation he's taken in his many years of prosecuting.

Name: Maya
Text: Really!? He doesn't take vacations!? Like... go to the sea, or, uh, to the mountains? Don't tell me he's never been to Europe!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: You have strange ideas about vacations, Maya.

Name: Grossberg
Text: In any case... That was the only time he took a vacation from work. I believe the penalty upset him quite a lot.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Odd... If he wanted to keep a perfect record so badly... why would he take such a long vacation?)

Name: Maya
Text: What do we do, Nick? von Karma is going to bring up DL-6, you can bet on it! What if Mr. Edgeworth pleads guilty to DL-6!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I won't let him!

Name: Grossberg
Text: Erm, yes, Mr. Wright... I hate to say this... But even accidental murder is murder, you know.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I know that! ... I... I just believe in Edgeworth's innocence! I can't believe he'd kill someone!

Name: Maya
Text: B-but, Nick! Mr. Edgeworth admits it himself! His father must have lied to protect him, beyond the grave...

Name: Phoenix
Text: I don't care! I know he's not guilty!

Name: Grossberg
Text: ... Mr. Wright... If you say so, I suppose I could go check again. The police files might hold something of interest.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. Grossberg... thank you!

Name: Grossberg
Text: I can't promise anything. In fact, I think the chances of finding something are slim.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I understand. (The police materials... hmm.)

Name: Maya
Text: There's hardly anyone here...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Everyone must be out looking for the old guy... Yogi.

Name: Police
Text: Ah, it's you. I don't think Gumshoe'll be coming back today. He's staying out late looking for someone.

Name: Maya
Text: Sounds like Detective Gumshoe is pounding the pavement for real! Um, we were wondering if we could check out the Records Room again...

Name: Police
Text: Well, now, I can't have just anyone wandering around in there. But... I guess Mr. von Karma is in there now, anyway. You can go in as long as he's there.

Name: Maya
Text: von Karma...?

Name: Police
Text: Yes. He just arrived actually.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (von Karma's in the Records Room!)

Name: Maya
Text: N-Nick! Let's hurry!

Name: Maya
Text: Dusty as always!

Name: Phoenix
Text: We were only here just yesterday. I'm sure they just haven't had time to clean... ...

Name: Maya
Text: What's wrong, Nick?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Nothing. I was just noticing that he isn't here. von Karma...

Name: Maya
Text: Huh? One of the drawers here is open.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Someone must have been looking in it recently.

Name: Maya
Text: The label says, "Unsolved Cases: Evidence"

Name: Phoenix
Text: Hmm... "Unsolved cases"?

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! The file for DL-6... it's completely empty!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Karma
Text: What are you doing in here!

Name: Maya
Text: Eeek! v-v-von Karma!

Name: Karma
Text: You...! ... How do you know my name?

Name: Maya
Text: Huh?

Name: Karma
Text: Have we met?

Name: Maya
Text: W-w-what are you saying!? We see each other every day, don't we? We're Miles Edgeworth's defense team!

Name: Karma
Text: Defense team...? Ahem. I beg your pardon, you see, I rarely remember defense attorneys. They are like bugs to me. Needless things, to be crushed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I can see how this guy was Edgeworth's mentor.)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Mr. von Karma, have a look at this.

Name: Phoenix
Text: This was you, wasn't it? You instructed Yanni Yogi to commit murder.

Name: Karma
Text: ... Yanni Yogi... How many years has it been since I've heard him called by that name. He's a fool. I told him to burn it after he read it.

Name: Maya
Text: ...! S-so you admit it! You... you wrote Mr. Yogi this letter!

Name: Karma
Text: Yes, my dear defense attorney. Thank you for taking the trouble to bring it to me. You've saved me from a lot of needless hassle.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Maya
Text: N-Nick! What is that thing!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: A stun gun. For self defense... usually.

Name: Karma
Text: Indeed. 600,000 volts will course through your body like a dog touching an electric fence.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Six hundred thous...!?

Name: Karma
Text: Oh, don't worry. People don't die from it, usually. Now, give me the letter.

Name: Maya
Text: Nooooooooooo!

Name: Karma
Text: Whoa! What are you--!?

Name: Maya
Text: N-Nick! Run!!! Aaaaaaaaaaaaah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: M-Maya!

Name: Karma
Text: Out of my way!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Waaaaaaaaaaaah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Ugh... he got us. The letter's... gone, of course. And he took the DL-6 evidence... all of it. Back to having no clues. Wait... Maya jumped first. Maya...! Is she okay? ...) Ma...Maya!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Maya! Open your eyes!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Maya!

Name: Maya
Text: ... The letter! Did he take it?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh!? Oh... yeah. A-are you okay!?

Name: Maya
Text: ... I... I couldn't stop him. I jumped as fast as I could, but one shot from that thing knocked me out cold. I'm useless. I'm not good as a lawyer, or a medium! I can't even call my sister. Not even now, when we need her the most. I wish I hadn't woken up at all.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Maya! (Grr! There has to be some way I can help her! I'd better do something about her self-confidence, first.) ...? (Maya... She's holding something! What is that? A bullet?) "DL-6 Incident, Evidence No. 7 Taken from the heart of Gregory Edgeworth." I remember... von Karma was holding this when Maya jumped him.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I'll prove it to you, Maya. You're most definitely not useless! I'll prove it to you in court tomorrow!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is it... judgment day. Today, things are gong to get settled at last... a lot of things.) Waaaaaaaargh! Wh-what's the big idea!?

Name: Maya
Text: S-s-sorry, Nick! I only touched your shoulder! I guess the "shock" hasn't worn off from my run-in with the stun gun yesterday. Anyhow, today's the last day of the trial! Good luck, Nick!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yeah... thanks, Maya.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Edgeworth is looking glum as always. I hope von Karma doesn't push him too hard.)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... Whooooooooaa! Wh-wh-what are you doing!?

Name: Maya
Text: Sorry! I'm sorry! I just thought I'd ch-cheer you up with a pat on the back...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Maya... Maybe you should go outside and discharge?

Name: Maya
Text: Right. Good idea.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Try not to electrocute anyone on your way out...)

Name: Gumshoe
Text: What's gotten into that girl?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Detective Gumshoe!

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Morning! Mr. Edgeworth?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Uh... good morning.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How did it go, Detective?

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Have no fear! As promised, I've captured our runaway caretaker! I just brought him in. Took all night, pal.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Thanks, Detective Gumshoe. You must be tired.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: Actually, after that shock I got on the way in, I feel pretty good.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Yogi says he's forgotten his own name... But that has to be a lie! Why would he want revenge on Edgeworth if he couldn't remember his past!? He does remember... and I'm going to prove it!)

Name: Judge
Text: Court is now in session for the trial of Mr. Miles Edgeworth.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The defense is ready, Your Honor.

Name: Karma
Text: ... The prosecution... is ready.

Name: Judge
Text: ... U-uh... right, very well. We have reached the final day of our proceedings in this trial. I ask that the prosecution submit decisive evidence.

Name: Karma
Text: Understood.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (C'mon! Don't be awed into silence by every little thing he says!)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, Mr. von Karma, your opening statement.

Name: Karma
Text: Right. Thanks to Detective Gumshoe's efforts, the boat rental shop caretaker has been arrested. In yesterday's trial, the defense asserted that the caretaker was the murderer. However, the caretaker has yet to confirm this. I would like to ask the defense to cross-examine him as much as necessary.

Name: Judge
Text: Very well! Please bring the witness into the courtroom.

Name: Karma
Text: Ladies and gentlemen of the court... I believe you all remember our witness. He lives in the boat rental shop on the lake, from where he witnessed the incident. In addition, he has currently lost memory of his name and identity.

Name: Judge
Text: Witness! Why did you run away yesterday?

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: The witness was not running away, as he will now testify.

Name: Judge
Text: I-I see. Very well, please begin your testimony.

Name: Uncle
Text: Zzz... mmph?

Name: Uncle
Text: Er, I'm really sorry about just leaving yesterday like I did.

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'd call what you did "running away," and not "just leaving." You heard Larry's testimony, and realized you were in danger!

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Now, Mr. Wright, there's no need to rush to conclusions. As I said, the witness was not "running away." Listen to the testimony.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (He sure seems relaxed! In fact, they both do--von Karma and Yanni Yogi!)

Name: Uncle
Text: But, I wasn't running away or nothing.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Then why did you leave!?

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: He's just about to say why! Is it so hard for you just quietly listen when someone is talking!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (If I sat quietly, Edgeworth would be guilty in three minutes!)

Name: Uncle
Text: I, uh, went to buy some food for Polly, see...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Food...?

Name: Uncle
Text: Well, Polly is a bit of a gourmand, you see. She only eats these high-quality bird pellets from France. They only have them in the big pet shop downtown.

Name: Phoenix
Text: But you weren't arrested until this morning! Why didn't you go back to the caretaker's shack?

Name: Uncle
Text: Er... well... I kind of got lost, you see.

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: The witness has trouble remembering things sometimes. When the police apprehended him, he was on his way back to the shack!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Yeah, right! Nice try von Karma! No one's going to believe that!)

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... I see! So he was lost!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Please! Your Honor, come to your senses!)

Name: Uncle
Text: I figured I got nothing to do with this incident anyhow.

Name: Phoenix
Text: You've lost much of your memory, is that correct?

Name: Uncle
Text: Er... ayup, seems like it.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Then how could you know that you didn't have anything to do with this incident!

Name: Uncle
Text: Uh...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Or... Or maybe you're lying about not having your memory, hmm? You know exactly who you are!

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: The witness has testified quite clearly that he has no memory of who he is. If you claim he's lying, then show the court proof!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Grr... How am I supposed to prove what's going on in that old codger's head? That's impossible!)

Name: Karma
Text: Hmph! I'm glad you've come to your senses, Mr. Wright. Very well, witness. Please continue.

Name: Uncle
Text: Er... I mean, I'd need one of those "motive" things, right? And I don't got one.

Name: Phoenix
Text: How can you say you had no motive? I say you do! You had a grudge against Edgeworth and the victim, Robert Hammond! That's why you took revenge on them! Right?

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Please don't make me repeat myself, Mr. Wright! This witness has no memory of anything beyond several years ago! He can't hold a grudge! It's impossible!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I have to prove he's lying about his memory... Otherwise, it's going to be the same thing over and over until the trial ends!)

Name: Judge
Text: Might I say something, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes... Yes, Your Honor?

Name: Judge
Text: You've been saying the same thing now over and over. You've been calling the witness's memory of the past or lack thereof into question. But, does this really have anything to do with the current case?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Of course, Your Honor. The witness has said he has "nothing to do with this case" and "no motive"... Both of these statements are lies!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Mr. Wright! There is a serious problem with your claim! Or... are you saying... Are you saying you know who this witness is!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Of course, Your Honor!

Name: Karma
Text: Ho hoh! Now, this is interesting. I would like to know myself! So, who is he?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Don't play dumb von Karma!)

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright, please tell us this witness's name.

Name: Phoenix
Text: His name is Yanni Yogi, a former court bailiff!

Name: Judge
Text: ... Yogi...? That name seems familiar. ... Oh! Yanni Yogi! From the DL-6 Incident!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I thought the judge would have heard of it... it was such a famous case.)

Name: Judge
Text: But, what does this mean?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! If this man is Mr. Yogi, then he has a clear motive!

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Tsk tsk tsk... Jumping to conclusions again, Mr. Wright! This man, this witness, is Yanni Yogi? Fascinating! However... How do you propose to prove this to the court?

Name: Karma
Text: This is a court of law, as you may recall. You need proof! And, allow me to repeat, once more, that the witness has lost his memory!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (This is it... I have to do this now! If I can't prove he's Yogi right here, right now... Then I've got nowhere else to go!)

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! How are you going to prove it!? How can you prove that he's Yanni Yogi?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's okay. It's actually quite simple. Your Honor! Please take this man's fingerprints! Then, we'll compare them to the fingerprints on file for Yanni Yogi 15 years ago...

Name: Judge
Text: I see... that makes sense.

Name: Karma
Text: Tsk tsk tsk!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh?

Name: Karma
Text: I'm so very, very sorry, Mr. Wright.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-why?

Name: Karma
Text: The witness... has no fingerprints!

Name: Phoenix
Text: What? What!? No fingerprints!?

Name: Uncle
Text: Er... you see, before I worked as a caretaker, I worked at a chemical plant. I burned my fingers working with the stuff. Ayup.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wh-what!? (Yogi, you sneak! You burned your fingerprints off to hide your past!)

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Well, if the witness has no fingerprints... I guess we will not be able to prove his identity.

Name: Karma
Text: Tsk tsk tsk... Well, what will you do, Mr. Wright?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Uh...

Name: Karma
Text: Hmm? It seems that the case has been decided, no?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (No!!! I know what happened! I know everything! I... I just can't prove it! But no... I can't let it end like this. I can't lose! There has to be another way!)

Name: Karma
Text: There is no one who can testify as to who this witness is! No one!

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! What are we going to do!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I didn't even consider that he might have erased his fingerprints... (What do I do!?)

Name: Karma
Text: Tsk tsk tsk... Well, Mr. Wright? Perhaps you'd like to cross-examine the parrot for a little comic relief, hmm?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Yeah, yeah, very funny. You're a sore winner, von Karma. ... Wait a second... "Cross-examine the parrot"?)

Name: Maya
Text: Wh-what is it, Nick? No... you're not going to...!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! The defense would like to take Mr. von Karma up on his proposal!

Name: Judge
Text: Take Mr. von Karma up?

Name: Karma
Text: On his... proposal?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Exactly, Your Honor! I would like to cross-examine the witness's pet parrot!

Name: Judge
Text: O-order! Order! Uh... well, what do you think, Mr. von Karma?

Name: Karma
Text: Need you even ask!? This is a farce! I object!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Wait a second! You were the one who suggested I cross-examine the parrot, von Karma! I have a right to do as you suggested!

Name: Karma
Text: Mmph... ... Well, if you're so desperate, then please, be my guest.

Name: Karma
Text: Of course, should you go through with this... And nothing comes of it, then I hope you're ready for the consequences.

Name: Maya
Text: Nick... this is crazy!

Name: Karma
Text: Well? Still want to go through with your little game!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Let the parrot take the stand. I will cross-examine her, Your Honor.

Name: Karma
Text: This is the most ridiculous thing I have ever heard!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (von Karma's rigged every person's testimony, every piece of evidence... Except the parrot! She's my last chance! At least... I think so.)

Name: Judge
Text: Bailiff! Bring in the parrot.

Name: Judge
Text: That's... quite a bird. Please tell us your name?

Name: Judge
Text: Name!

Name: Judge
Text: The witness is ignoring me.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It must be hurt... to be ignored by a bird.)

Name: Judge
Text: Ahem. Very well, witness... Who is your owner? Please, er... testify for us.

Name: Parrot
Text: "Hello! Hello!" *squawk*

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Certainly the most concise testimony we've had so far. Very well, begin your cross-examination.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Right...

Name: Maya
Text: What are you going to do, Nick?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... I... I don't know! What do we do, Maya?

Name: Maya
Text: Hmm...

Name: Parrot
Text: "Hello! Hello!" *squawk*

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Witness! You can't just say "hello" and expect us to get anywhere! I want you to testify! Maya, you talk to her.

Name: Maya
Text: R-right! Uh... What do I say?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Maybe I should get her to say her name?)

Name: Maya
Text: Polly! Polly! What's your name?

Name: Parrot
Text: "Pol-ly! Pol-ly!" *squawk*

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright... I think we've established that this parrot is named "Polly." Does this have anything to do with her owner's identity?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes it does!

Name: Karma
Text: Hah! Fascinating! You claim that the parrot's name will prove her owner's identity? Then show us this proof!

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! Don't you think you're taking the bluffing a little too far?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Listen. We've not here to answer the question of "who is the caretaker." We're here to prove that he is Yanni Yogi! All we have to do is tie the name "Polly" to Yogi!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor. The proof that the parrot's name reveals the caretaker's identity is...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Judge
Text: The DL-6 Case File?

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: That's quite a large file you have there! Which page is this "proof" on, then? Show us, or stop wasting our time!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Very well. Mr. Wright, please show us the page. Where in this file is the information connected to this parrot's name?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's on the "Suspect Data" page!

Name: Phoenix
Text: This page has all the information about Yanni Yogi! Right after he was arrested, his fiancee committed suicide, see?

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Indeed, it does say that, yes.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What was his fiancee's name?

Name: Judge
Text: "Polly Jenkins"... "Polly"!

Name: Phoenix
Text: Exactly, Your Honor! He remembered the name of his fiancee who committed suicide. That's why he named his parrot after her!

Name: Judge
Text: I see! I guess that is possible.

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Bah! A mere coincidence, that's all! My granddaughter has a dog she calls "Phoenix." Well, Mr. Phoenix Wright? Does this make you my granddaughter's fiancee!? She's only seven years old!!!

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Indeed. Alone, it is a little weak for evidence in a murder trial. We would need some other corroborating evidence...

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Where am I going to find that!?)

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! We're getting closer! One more! If we can just get one more piece of evidence...!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Right... but what?)

Name: Karma
Text: Hmph!

Name: Judge
Text: Very well, witness. You may continue.

Name: Parrot
Text: "Hello! Hello!" *squawk*

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Witness! You can't just say "hello" and expect us to get anywhere! I want you to testify! Maya, you talk to her.

Name: Maya
Text: R-right! Uh... What do I say?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Maybe I'll get her to say the number of that safe...)

Name: Maya
Text: Huh? The safe? Why?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Let's just try to get her to say anything, okay?

Name: Maya
Text: Polly! What was the number of the safe in the shack?

Name: Judge
Text: ... My, what a reckless parrot. Well, Mr. Wright? You aren't claiming that this number has something to do with the caretaker?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Actually it does! That's why I had her say it!

Name: Karma
Text: Hah! Ridiculous! How can the number to a safe tell us who the caretaker is? Show us your proof! What could possibly link this number to the caretaker's true identity!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Karma
Text: The DL-6 Case File? What is this obsession you have with that case?

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. Wright. Where in this file is something relating to the safe number?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's on the "Case Summary" page!

Name: Judge
Text: The Case... Summary?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Specifically, the date on which the DL-6 Incident occurred!

Name: Judge
Text: The date of the incident? December 28...? Why, that's today's date. Fifteen years ago!

Name: Phoenix
Text: And the number on that safe is 1228!

Name: Judge
Text: Ah!

Name: Phoenix
Text: He used the date of the DL-6 Incident as the number for his safe, Your Honor! That's how important that date was to him!

Name: Judge
Text: I see... it certainly is an interesting coincidence. People often do set their secret numbers to dates.

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Bah! This is not tangible proof! I set my ATM card's number to "0001" because I'm number one! This has nothing to do with a date! Nothing!

Name: Judge
Text: That's enough! I think we've reached a conclusion here.

Name: Karma
Text: This is a mere coincidence, that's all!

Name: Judge
Text: True, that is a possibility. However, two coincidences at the same time seems more like a "pattern" to me.

Name: Karma
Text: Wh... what are you saying!?

Name: Judge
Text: Summon the caretaker of the boat shop. Immediately!

Name: Judge
Text: Witness... Tell us your name.

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Wait! This witness, he doesn't remember...

Name: Uncle
Text: No... it's okay.

Name: Uncle
Text: I've accomplished what I wanted to do. I'm done.

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! He looks totally different!

Name: Phoenix
Text: This is the real Yogi, I think. Finally. He's been acting feeble to hide his true identity. Acting... for 15 years!

Name: Judge
Text: W-well...! Let me ask you again. Please state your name for the court!

Name: Yogi
Text: My name... is Yanni Yogi. 15 years ago, I served as a bailiff in this very court.

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! Yanni Yogi! So was it you who killed Robert Hammond...? And tried to frame Miles Edgeworth for his death?

Name: Yogi
Text: ... Yes. It was me. I did it. ... They put me on the witness stand 15 years ago... Robert Hammond... he said I was mentally unsound. He told me it would make me innocent. Get me off the hook. So... I pretended to have brain damage... I was innocent, really! But he didn't believe me! We won the trial... But I lost everything. I lost my job, my fiancee, my social standing... ... Then, this year, 15 years later... A package arrived. It was a letter... and a pistol. The plan was written out in careful detail. It was a plan to take my revenge on the people who ruined my life. I didn't care who had sent it. I thought this was my chance, after 15 years, this was it! Finally, a chance to have my revenge on Robert Hammond and Miles Edgeworth... I have no regrets.

Name: Judge
Text: W-wait a moment! Revenge... against Miles Edgeworth? What do you mean?

Name: Yogi
Text: I'm not at liberty to speak on that matter. Why don't you ask Mr. Edgeworth yourself? Anyway, I admit it, I was the one who killed Robert Hammond.

Name: Judge
Text: von Karma... Where is Mr. Yogi?

Name: Karma
Text: Under arrest, Your Honor. I saw no room for error in his confession.

Name: Judge
Text: Then... the defendant, Miles Edgeworth is...

Name: Karma
Text: Innocent. In this case, at least.

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm. Very well. Will the defendant please take the stand?

Name: Judge
Text: There are a few mysteries left unsolved. Still, you are cleared of suspicion for this particular case. So I would like to pass judgment on the murder of Mr. Robert Hammond. Any objections?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (I don't believe it! Why isn't von Karma saying anything?)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. This court finds the defendant, Mr. Miles Edgeworth...

Name: Judge
Text: Not Guilty

Name: Judge
Text: That is all. The court is adjourned!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Judge
Text: D-did someone just say "objection"?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (It wasn't von Karma...! Wait, but that means...) No... Edgeworth!?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Your Honor. I object to your judgment.

Name: Judge
Text: Wh-what do you mean?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'm not innocent at all! As we have heard, Yanni Yogi killed Robert Hammond in revenge. But, revenge for what?

Name: Maya
Text: Nick! Edgeworth is trying to confess! He's going to say he's guilty! He's going to tell them he was the murderer in the DL-6 Incident! He's going to tell them he killed his own dad!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Uh oh! What do I do?)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The judgment has already been passed! I object to Edgeworth's outburst...

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Didn't something like this happen yesterday, too? I believe a certain witness raised an objection after a guilty verdict was passed.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That would be Larry...)

Name: Karma
Text: We must hear this new statement! We must hear Miles Edgeworth!

Name: Judge
Text: He's right. We have a duty to hear Mr. Edgeworth out.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: For fifteen years... I have had a recurring dream. A nightmare... it's only a nightmare. That's what I told myself. But now I know, it wasn't a dream. Yanni Yogi wasn't the killer.

Name: Judge
Text: You mean... in the incident where your father died?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: From the distance of the shot, it wasn't suicide, either. Everything was as clear as day. The murderer... The criminal in the DL-6 Incident... It was me! Your Honor! I confess my guilt! I am guilty for DL-6, the statute of limitations of which ends today! The culprit... is me!

Name: Judge
Text: Order! Order! This is certainly unexpected! The defendant, declared innocent, is confessing to another crime! A crime for which the statute of limitations runs out today! I'm not really sure how I should deal with this...

Name: Karma
Text: Bah! It's obvious. We hold a trial. Right here. Right now. We try this man for his crime of fifteen years ago!

Name: Judge
Text: I think... I think I would like to take a five minute recess. During this time, I will consider the appropriate course of action to take. Court is adjourned!

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I'm sorry, Wright. I've just wasted all of your effort.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ... Mr. Edgeworth... I just don't believe it, pal! I mean, you... kill your dad?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I didn't want to believe it myself, Detective! But... it's the truth. I deserve to be punished. Murder is murder, no matter what the circumstances.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: This is crazy! Just crazy!

Name: Maya
Text: ... ...? Nick? What are you doing?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Oh... I was just reading through the Court Record once more. I'm getting my case ready.

Name: Maya
Text: Your case... for what?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Huh? Isn't it obvious? I'm going to prove that Miles Edgeworth is innocent.

Name: Gumshoe
Text: ...! Wh-what are you talking about, pal! He just admitted to it! He confessed that he did it! In court!

Name: Phoenix
Text: I'm sorry, Edgeworth. But I don't believe in your "nightmare."

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Wh-what!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's just a dream. It's not real. The truth is right here in this Court Record. In any case, tighten your belts. The real fight is just beginning. I'll prove you're innocent. Trust me.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: W-Wright...

Name: Judge
Text: Then, I would like to resume our trial.

Name: Karma
Text: Judge! Miles Edgeworth has admitted his own guilt. He has confessed his crime. Let us begin by hearing his testimony. Then, though pointless, let the defense do their cross-examining. The statute of limitations on the DL-6 Incident runs out today. Though it's unconventional for me, I'd like to run this one by the book.

Name: Judge
Text: I see. Does the defense have any objections?

Name: Phoenix
Text: No, Your Honor. (von Karma... you knew this was going to happen from the very beginning, didn't you!)

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. Will Miles Edgeworth take the stand?

Name: Karma
Text: Will the witness state his name and profession.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Miles Edgeworth... I am a prosecuting attorney.

Name: Karma
Text: Mr. Edgeworth. Fifteen years ago, you mistakenly killed your father, Gregory Edgeworth. Is this correct?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: ... It is correct.

Name: Karma
Text: Then testify about this matter to the court.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (When Edgeworth was telling me about his dream yesterday I noticed something... One detail didn't quite fit. That will be the key... but only if I can get it to work!)

Name: Maya
Text: Please... Please...

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... And, until now, you thought this memory was a "dream"?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: We were stuck in that elevator for five hours. The oxygen in the elevator ran out, and I lost my memory of the events.

Name: Karma
Text: Bah! The same claim Mr. Yogi has made!

Name: Judge
Text: Very well. Mr. Wright? Your cross-examination, please.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Yes, Your Honor.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: That day, I had gone to the courtroom to observe one of my father's trials.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What was the trial your father was involved in on that day?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I don't remember things very clearly. Only two things... I know my father lost, and Mr. von Karma was the prosecuting attorney.

Name: Judge
Text: Mr. von Karma? You were handling that case?

Name: Karma
Text: It was fifteen years ago. I don't remember the details.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (That was when Edgeworth pointed out the problem in von Karma's evidence...)

Name: Edgeworth
Text: As we went to leave, an earthquake struck, trapping us in the elevator.

Name: Phoenix
Text: So, there were three people including yourself trapped in that elevator?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes. Myself, my father, and Yanni Yogi. We were fine at first... But then as time passed, and no one came to help...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: My father and Mr. Yogi lost their composure, and began to argue.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What did you do then?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I was a nine-year-old boy at the time. What could I do? I was scared... Trembling, in the corner. But then...

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Just then, something heavy fell at my feet.

Name: Phoenix
Text: What was it?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: A pistol. I assume it was the bailiff, Yanni Yogi's. The safety must have come off when it fell from his holster.

Name: Karma
Text: And you picked it up. What happened next?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I picked it up, and threw it at Mr. Yogi. I wanted them to stop fighting.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Did you know it was a pistol when you threw it?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I think I knew. I knew it was dangerous. But... the air was getting so thick. I panicked.

Name: Karma
Text: So, you're saying that you threw the pistol at Mr. Yogi.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: I was... in a daze.

Name: Edgeworth
Text: A moment later, there was a single gunshot, then a scream.

Name: Phoenix
Text: Holdit.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: The gun fired once?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes... I think... after I threw it, I lost consciousness. Since then... They've echoed in my head, every day. That gunshot, and that horrible scream.

Name: Phoenix
Text: The scream...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Are you sure you only heard one gunshot?

Name: Edgeworth
Text: Yes. I'm sure of that. I heard the shot, and the scream... Then everything faded. I was unconscious until the rescuers came.

Name: Judge
Text: I see...

Name: Phoenix
Text: But that doesn't make sense! Look at this file one more time. This plainly contradicts the witness's testimony.

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: You do enjoy dragging out that file, don't you? I don't accept this evidence! Unless... you can tell us what page it's on! Which page contradicts Miles Edgeworth's testimony?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Look at the "Victim Data" in this file! It says quite plainly: "the murder weapon was fired twice"! Miles Edgeworth only heard one gunshot! Yet, the murder weapon was fired twice! The first shot was the accidental firing when the pistol was thrown. So... who fired the remaining shot!?

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... Was there, perhaps, another shooter who fired that second shot?

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: Your Honor. As I'm sure you're aware... This incident occurred fifteen years ago. The evidence is dated... The pistol did fire twice. However, we do not know WHEN that second shot was fired. It might have been fired the day before the incident! There is no proof that the second shot had anything to do with this incident!

Name: Phoenix
Text: (What...!)

Name: Judge
Text: Hmm... I see, I see. You do have a point. Mr. Wright? The murder weapon was fired twice, as we have heard. One of those shots was fired by the defendant, a boy at the time. Do you have any proof that the other shot fired had something to do with the case?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor. I think I will be able to show you proof.

Name: Karma
Text: Wh-what!? Impossible!

Name: Judge
Text: Now, now, Mr. von Karma. Save your surprise for after you've seen the evidence. Very well, Mr. Wright. Show us your proof. Do you have evidence that the second firing of the pistol is related to this incident?

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: Look at this photograph.

Name: Judge
Text: This is a photograph of the scene of the crime, fifteen years ago. I can see that the victim lying there is Gregory Edgeworth...

Name: Phoenix
Text: This proves the murder weapon was fired twice, at the time of the incident! This photo proves it!

Name: Judge
Text: ... So, let me get this straight. This photo proves two shots were fired? Where?

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Y-Your Honor, please... Please get a clue! Show the judge the contradiction in the photo!)

Name: Phoenix
Text: Takethat.gif

Name: Phoenix
Text: As should be obvious, the contradiction is here.

Name: Judge
Text: I see... a bullet hole in the door...

Name: Phoenix
Text: Your Honor! Gregory Edgeworth was killed by a shot from the pistol! Yet, there is also a bullet hole in the elevator door! We also know that the murder weapon was fired twice! Thus... Someone other than Edgeworth fired that second shot!

Name: Judge
Text: O-order! Order! Mr. Wright! What are you driving at?

Name: Phoenix
Text: It's simple, Your Honor. At the time of the incident, two shots were fired. One went into Gregory Edgeworth's heart. The other hit the elevator door. Remember that the defendant lost consciousness after the shot he fired rang out. In conclusion... We must agree that the second shot was fired by someone else!

Name: Judge
Text: M-Mr. Wright! But who could that someone else be!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: The murderer, of course!

Name: Karma
Text: Objection.gif

Name: Karma
Text: ... I knew I should have stepped in before your wild fantasies got out of hand. Mr. Wright... Look once more at the DL-6 Incident case file. Look closely. Try the "Case Summary" page.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (The "Case Summary"... that's on page 1.)

Name: Karma
Text: Look what is written there! "Not a single clue was found on the scene."

Name: Karma
Text: If the pistol had indeed been fired two times... Then the other bullet would have been discovered on the scene!

Name: Judge
Text: He does have a point.

Name: Karma
Text: That second bullet has never been found! Why? Because the second bullet does not exist! The bullet that claimed Gregory Edgeworth's life was the one fired by his own son! That is the truth of this matter. The whole truth. It was undoubtedly something else that made that bullet hole in the door.

Name: Judge
Text: Order! I will have order! ... Mr. Wright has proven one thing to us quite clearly... That the murder weapon was fired twice at the time of the incident. However! As Mr. von Karma says, the second bullet was not found. It is highly unlikely that the police merely overlooked this second bullet. So, all we have is the single bullet fired. I'm afraid I have to discount the defense's claim.

Name: Karma
Text: Tsk tsk tsk... I praise the judge for his wisdom in his matter.

Name: Phoenix
Text: (Gah! How did this happen!? I don't believe that the second bullet didn't exist! Was I wrong? Have I been wrong about this whole incident?)

Name: Maya
Text: What are you doing, Nick!? Why aren't you raising an objection!?

Name: Phoenix
Text: ... I'm sorry, Maya.

Name: Maya
Text: What?

Name: Phoenix
Text: I... It looks like I was wrong.

Name: Maya
Text: Nick...?

Name: Phoenix
Text: If the second bullet wasn't there, then all my conjectures are for nothing!

Name: Maya
Text: N-no... But you said you'd do it, Nick! You said you'd get Edgeworth declared innocent!

Name: Phoenix
